Reviews.Title: “Convenient location in Westwood”
Reviews.Author: terinay
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. We got upgraded to the penthouse floor (thanks to the husband's SPG rewards membership level) which was pretty nice. Our room was spacious, clean, and modern. I'm usually very picky about my shampoo, conditioner, body lotion, etc, and would always bring mine with me from home as I do not like using the generic hotel products. However, I really loved the products provided by the hotel. The hotel spa downstairs uses these same products that are provided in the rooms. If you are enrolled in their SPG rewards program, they have an eco-green program that allows you to get an additional 500 points for each day that you decline housekeeping to come into your room. You can still request for more toiletries if you need, should you decide to go with this eco-green route. Afterall, we don't need a change of freshly laundered towels everyday, do we? The check-in staff did tell us that under California law, they are required to have housekeeping come in at least once every 3 days. So if you are there for several days, you can choose which day you want or don't want housekeeping. The check-in staff was polite and courteous. Concierge was always friendly and greeted us whenever we stepped out of the hotel (whenever they were around and not disappearing to help other guests, that is). The location of the hotel is pretty good and safe in Westwood . Given its proximity to UCLA, they have a relatively reliable bus system (probably unheard of in LA). It is just a short bus ride away to Beverly Hills (15mins) and Santa Monica (25 mins).... a rarity given that you generally need a car to get around LA.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: DepartingDuo
Reviews.Content: Checkin was super. Associate gave us several recommendations for how to get around and good local places to eat near attractions. She also offered their "back yard" pool area as a lunch option. Room was lovely--a suite that felt like home. Backyard restaurant by pool was disappointing. We were seated and never waited on. A waitress finally glanced our way and I motioned for her to come over. We were not her table so she took our drink order and said a gentleman would be over to take the food order. He took his time coming over. We wondered if it was his first day or if he just didn't care. Food took for-ever to arrive. He never checked on us or refilled our drinks. We left a pitiful tip. We did attempt to sit by the pool the next day. Unfortunately it was full and we decided not to hang around at the bar waiting for lounge chairs to open up. We were afraid we would get the same waiter. There are plenty of other places to eat. Hotel is worth staying at I just wouldn't eat near the pool. Besides the poor service it also wasn't a value for our dollar. They are charging way too much money for pizza and sandwiches. We enjoyed the suite and had a great view of UCLA and the city. We visited the Bliss spa. That was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, Tired facility”
Reviews.Author: HollyMSanFrancisco
Reviews.Content: The W Hotel in Westwood must have been a knock out 15 years ago. The rooms and overall facility are very worn and not better for the wear! The service throughout was great, attentive but not overly obsequesious. The restaurant food (we had breakfast only) was also well prepared and served. The only complaint was the condition of the rooms which were not very clean and looked very worn. The W Westwood needs a facelift.

Reviews.Title: “Finally Found a Hotel I Like in LA”
Reviews.Author: Publius28
Reviews.Content: To be honest, I never look forward to staying anywhere in Los Angeles, probably due to some poor experiences before. But that changed with my recent one-night stay at the W in Westwood. In short, I love the neighbourhood and I love the hotel even more. Unlike other Ws, it is trendy but not overly trendy. The room was spacious and although the gentleman at check-in didn’t mention it outright, I think he upgraded my suite to an even bigger suite. An unfortunate incident with the shower in the room was the only negative but I am sure it was more a mechanical issue rather than a standard of the rooms there. I drove into the hotel at 7pm and was greeted by a friendly gentleman at the valet desk who quickly took care of my car and bags for me. Check-in was equally swift and within minutes, I was on my way to my room. Upon entering, I was surprised that it was bigger than what I remembered booking. It started with a seating area with sofas and an office table, with an adjoining bathroom, then the room continues with another two separate rooms, one the bedroom and the other, another living room with a sofa bed. Since I was travelling solo, it was simply too much. The bed was very comfortable and easily took care of my Zs. The only negative during my entire stay was with the shower. The water pressure was extremely strong, like Niagara Falls-strong, and it was either that or no pressure at all. That shouldn’t be a problem at all for me but the temperature also fluctuated between heaven and hell. One second, it was lukewarm, another it would be scalding hot and next it would be ice cold. Since it was already late by the time I took a shower and I was tired, I fought through and managed to get it done. I complained to the hotel staff upon check-out and they apologized. I really hope they would have fixed it by now because someone could get hurt. On my next trip to LA, I would definitely stay at the W again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: averytfunk
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very service oriented. The front desk, the concierages, the wait staff and the doormen were exceptional in their attention to our needs. Our suite was comfortable but very dark. We had to have all of our lights on when we were in the rooms. Also, the HVAC system seemed to be sluggish. However, the food was excellent and we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Quality Control, Good food, Good Service”
Reviews.Author: traveler2542b
Reviews.Content: I liked the 1-bedroom suite. There was plenty of room. The food was really good-more than just hotel food. Breakfast was a standout. Service was generally excellent. The front desk was very responsive when there were problems--which there were. Except for having to remind the server at the pool that a half hour was too long to be forgotten, room service and other dining service was great. The concierge we saw, Karron, was really friendly and helpful. 1. Climate control didn’t work. It was hot when I entered the room. The bellman offered to adjust the temperature. He turned the temperature down. Through the long sweaty night, the air conditioning didn’t come on. By morning I had turned the thermostat down to 60. The thermometer read 72. It was steamy. 2. The windows didn’t open, so no relief was available. 3. I informed the front desk of the in the morning. They sent up a repair person, who left a card saying that the problem was repaired. When I arrived back in the room, it was hot. The thermometer said 72, even though the thermostat was set to 60. Actual temperature was 76. This was true in both rooms of the suite. 4. That evening, I asked the front desk to repair it or move me. Right away, a friendly maintenance person came to the room. He explained, in a way I didn’t understand, why the climate system could not work and yet it was working as designed, and that the temperature setting on the thermostat was irrelevant and had nearly no effect on the system, something about coolant water needing to be reset for many or all rooms at some other location in the hotel other than my room. He opened the windows. 5. With the open windows, I was able to sleep eventually, on the second night. 6. I signed onto and paid for internet access in my room. It worked great for an hour before dinner. After dinner, I needed to upload some work to my office. But I could not sign on. There was no signal. I called the desk. They connected me to tech support. I spent about an hour with a friendly person. After an hour of her repeatedly restarting something at their end—there was and is nothing wrong with my computer, which connected perfectly in the lobby—she was able to get my computer connected for no more than a second or two before the signal disappeared again. 7. Every hotel is currently using the television as a revenue source. Theirs, however, is unusually annoying. Every time the TV is turned on (see photo), I had to page through many (6) different stops of pay services to get directly to regular free TV. Although there was a channel 'guide,' this only said what network was on which channel number. There was no guide to what shows were on. There are no cable systems that don’t provide this, so why not share the secret with your guests? I can only imagine it's to drive guests to pay TV. 8. There is a large, heavy, immobile round piece of furniture in the living room of the suite (see photo). It is not useful as a room-service table because it’s only about 15 inches high. Since it can’t be moved, it interferes with use of the room rather than enhances it. After the first time, I insisted that room service bring up a table with my order. 9. There are zero outlets anywhere near the bed. Forget having your cell phone on the night table, recharging. Bring an extension cord with you. Make it a long one, since there aren't outlets even near the side of the bed. The hotel's lamp and radio occupy all the plugs on the extension cord they use that goes toward the wall in the middle of the headboard. If you want to use that, know that it's not 3-prong, and that you not have either a lamp or an alarm clock. 10. There is minimal clearance at the foot of the bed (see photo). So you, like me and all the other guests, will sleep on one side of the bed. The mattress, at one point in the distant past, have been luxurious. Now, however, the sleeping side is like a rigid hammock into which your body will have to fold whether it fits or not. There is nothing about my experience I want to repeat. There is nothing about my stay that suggests a first-class hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel however We did not feel al home”
Reviews.Author: Guillermo H
Reviews.Content: The hotel facilities are good as in any other W however our room was quite noisey And We could hear everything that was happening On the hallway! We could not rest well And the rooms are not as comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Westwood”
Reviews.Author: LondonBlinker
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for about a month in May. Nice hotel, really comfortable rooms, nice bar and decent restaurant. Though, be warned the restaurant isn't really restaurant. For example, having tried everything on the menu I asked for an Omelette and chips. Much as the staff wanted to help they couldn't because they don't cook anything on site. Yes, five star hotel with a restaurant that isn't a restaurant. Shock. Horror. Alarm! Too be honest most hotel restaurants seem to be like this these days so I am probably being a bit precious.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York, New York, United States
Reviews.Title: “HouseKeeping Is Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Ken S
Reviews.Content: I have stayed many times at the W Los Angeles and I love coming back because it's like being at home. All things are taken care of and given great detail. The housekeeping staff particularly make sure that your room is in excellent shape when you get home and have it feel like a home away from home. Josefa Mendoza was the lady that took care of my room and it was amazing to come home every night to great attention to detail.

Reviews.Title: “Fun and trendy hotel, but more for couples than families”
Reviews.Author: Strae
Reviews.Content: A converted old commercial building in the heart of UCLA / Westwood area. Rooms are generously sized and the decor is typical W - modern, stylish and impressively detailed. The pool area is a plus, but is the kind of place you expect to be filled with PYTs checking each other out rather than the laughter of children. We arrived with our 3 year old and found it a little intimidating at 3pm in the afternoon - most of the lounges / cabanas near the pool were taken up by painstakingly coiffed and groomed types with carefully planned tans sipping cocktails who did not seem impressed when we arrived with our excited son avec les pool toys. Staff on the other hand were very welcoming and perhaps on other day, with another crowd, the pool would have been more inviting. The hotel restaurant also doubles as a very trendy bar in the evenings and can come across all power-breakfast and business meeting-like during the mornings. Concierge was very helpful and knowledgeable (and importantly not pushy) so please do take advantage in terms of restaurant choice etc. Overall, a very nice stay but not really somewhere we'd want to hang out for more than 1-2 nights at a stretch unless travelling for work. The area is more downtempo than other parts of LA, so makes for a change of pace and the neighbourhood offers lots of interesting dining and shopping options.

Reviews.Title: “For the Rich”
Reviews.Author: Sparky8188
Reviews.Content: First impression was when we pulled up and nobody would help us or guide us to the entrance, etc. I had to pull my own luggage out of the car while the W employee (who looked to be a member of management b/c he was in a suit) just stood beside me. I had two wheeled bags that my daughter and I had to lug up the stairs without any assistance (there is no ramp). This shocked me given that there were 2 employees standing around NOT BUSY when we arrived. I'm all for independence but come on...this is the W!!! I am an SPG Platinum member and received an upgrade to a Fabulous Suite which was spacious and quiet as all the other reviews have mentioned. Cons to room: We had shower issues, and the TINY TINY TINY supplied hairdryer overheated and when they brought me a new one it was much larger and they couldn't believe the room still had the tiny "old" one. Really? Wouldn't housekeeping notice this before it had to overheat and almost set the place on fire? Our trip to the pool was met with poor service and NO TOWELS! Everyone was asking for towels and we kept being told "we don't have anything to do with the pool" by the wait staff. You gotta get some help out there by the pool!! It is pricey to stay here! We did get free internet b/c of the platinum status but everything else cost us a pretty penny! the 9:30 restaurant is very pricey! In the morning they do offer coffee and tea complimentary but anything else (pastry, hard boiled egg, cereal) is $5.00 and up. Pancakes $15.00. A burger $15.00 (for a kid)!!! Just go to Ralph's and get you some snacks and then eat at one of the local restaurants around town. We were charged to have a 4 page document printed ($1.00 a page). The only thing free to print is the boarding passes for airlines. The entire staff should be friendly at all times and I didn't find this to be the case at this W. I felt the staff to be a little snobby and pretentious. You are supposed to get bottled waters when you leave but not once did we get offered one. I saw plenty of people being offered waters but never in our 3 night stay did we get offered a water. Maybe b/c our rental car wasn't nice enough...I don't know. It's definitely a swanky place for the rich and famous and if that's your style then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous as expected from a W..but no free internet??”
Reviews.Author: LGF90
Reviews.Content: The W Westwood was in the perfect location for me - I had business at UCLA which is within walking distance. Westwood is a cute little residential suburb. Although quiet on weekends, on week days the cute cafes and shops are packed with college students and staff. The lobby and bar are classic W. Staff at the welcome desk and concierge were very helpful, and the bell boys brought my bags up straight away. I have stayed at the W in a number of cities world wide but this was the first time I have been upgraded (from a Wonderful room to the Spectacular Suite), which was HUGE considering I was visiting alone! It had a separate lounge and dining area. The bathroom was an odd shape but the shower pressure and towels were good and replaced and cleaned thoroughly each day. Ordered one of the "make your own burger"s for in-room dinner one night and was pleasantly surprised it only took about 15-20 minutes. Was very yummy! The pool itself isn't huge but there are lots of sun beds and cabanas so it didn't feel over crowded. Didn't have time to eat at the backyard restaurant unfortunately, but the food I saw people eating looked lovely, and it's a gorgeous spot to sit out on a warm day! This hotel does allow pets. I don't own any pets and was a little worried about noise from dogs in near by rooms, but didn't hear anything at all at night. Not even the music coming from the lobby which was VERY loud on friday night, but I love the young cool W vibe that comes with the chain. The main frustration about this hotel: I HATE that the internet is not free. If I can go to Starbucks and pay $4 for a coffee and get free wifi, surely a hotel where I'm paying $250+++ a night should include it?? $14 per day is insane in this day in age. Otherwise up to the great W standard that I love!

Reviews.Title: “This is not a business hotel”
Reviews.Author: MillionsRoadWarrior
Reviews.Content: Bring an all black workout-suit if you want to use their gym, along with all the "beautiful people". After 9pm the lobby is not that of a hotel but of the adjoining health club. It is a decent location if you have work nearby, but it is definitely a hang-out spot for the area. The huevos rancheros is quite avant garde here, worth trying out for breakfast if you stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Consistently Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Dwatts01
Reviews.Content: I travel a lot -- for business and for pleasure (with my family). I have stayed at the W Westwood several times over the past 2-3 years (during business and family trips). While some hotels can "fall off" in key areas of quality, my experience with this place has been consistently excellent. The location is a bit off the beaten path; but this makes it a nice retreat, with everything you might need on the property (luxurious yet cool atmosphere, pool, nice bar). Most importantly, a commitment to good service has been apparent in my interaction with the staff during each visit (from the Welcome desk, to the Concierge, Housekeeping, and pool bar). Also, they have a "W Insider" (who apparently tracks repeat customers to help ensure a good experience). This person made sure the Welcome desk was aware of my check in requests -- and they went out of their way to accommodate, even though I was a bit crazy during check in (on the phone, multi-tasking). Bottom line, this is one of those "can't miss" places.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale but relaxed, comfortable and friendly”
Reviews.Author: P-Fogg-1873
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 5 nights, with wife, for work and vacation, 1st time to LA Location: -across the street from UCLA campus and medical center -Westwood is a great neighborhood, both residential and with a cute "downtown" with cafes, many restaurants, a little shopping, multiple movie theaters and grocery stores (all 1-5 min walk from hotel). -need a car to get to other LA areas (5 min to Bel Air, Brentwood, Beverly Hills) (10 mins to Santa Monica) (15 min to West Hollywood) (20 min to Pacific Pallisades) (30 min to Malibu). Decor/Style -like all W's, great look and vibe. a little too "LA" - couple of Ferrari's/Aston Martin's parked out front; but it was relaxed, no one was trying too hard to be cool or trendy. everyone was laid back and friendly. -rooms are all suite type with separate living rooms and bedrooms. for the $, a great value. bathrooms are large, modern and verything works well. linens are soft and what you'd expect. -a very nice gym, outside pool area and garden Food -didnt try restaurant, so many options right in the neighborhood -free snacks put out every afternoon in the lobby Staff -excellent all around. eg- helped us with the thermostat personally every night -concierge was above and beyond (followed up to see how we liked our sightseeing, printed directions without us asking, etc) -parking attendants were very friendly, and got to know us after 2 days Notes -parking is $28/day; pricey, but its LA and parking is tough in the area (need a nieghborhood pass) -free water from the parking guys, dont need to pay for it at the hotel Overall What you'd expect from a W: stylish, comfortable hotel with excellent service in a great location. No disappointments at all, and we were very happy here, didnt want to leave after 5 days!

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: JEMO1
Reviews.Content: This hotel is first rate! From the doormen, to the concierge, and especially the decor!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location & sweet staff, but inconsistent”
Reviews.Author: ilovemanhattanNyc
Reviews.Content: Once you get over the sight of the old, concrete, vine-laced building, there is a charm to the W in Westwood. It is in a terrific location. It has the full W 'vibe,' and a happening pool (even though 'Entourage' is no longer filming). Most of the staff is terrific and helpful, Those are the ones who remember you from trip to trip. The Wheels (car valets) are great, and the bell staff has improved 1,000%, much to my delight. No problems with wake-up calls or finding outlets. Towels are OK, not particularly big or lush and in need of an upgrade. Amenities, like 99% of W's, are Bliss. The Bliss spa is nice, but not as nice or accommodating as the Bliss in the W Hollywood. The engineering staff was very helpful, as I was in a room that had no air conditioning that worked because it was 55F in LA (never mind what it was in the room or that I like to sleep in a chilly room). Housekeeping is below average & without attention to detail. The front desk is OK, not great. It was sweet that they apologized they couldn't give me (SPG platinum) an upgrade for my entire stay (4 nights) due to demand. OK. That is nice. That was, however, the last I heard from anyone, including management throughout my stay. That was a bit surprising since I'd been in that hotel quite often.

Reviews.Title: “Very spacious rooms, nice breakfast service, average front desk service.”
Reviews.Author: TAP647
Reviews.Content: A nice location near Wilshire Blvd. Rooms are extremely spaciousl. Overall a pleasant stay and worth a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, convenient location, large rooms”
Reviews.Author: ceum_49
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the W Westwood March 1-5, 2012 in a double suite. The double suites are are a good size--would be great for a family of four. The rooms are upscale, clean--I'm really picky, and the furnishings are updated. However, due to the location of the double suites in the hotel they are fairly dark, which is disappointing if you are looking forward to sunny CA. The hotel staff is very friendly and accommodating and the public spaces are nice, especially the pool area. It's an easy drive from LAX, and a good location for navigating LA. The neighborhood is safe, has good restaurants, and a shopping area typical of what you would find around a university. Parking at the hotel is $35/night and you must valet, but there is a parking ramp at the end of the street that charges $14/night, a bargain for LA.

Reviews.Title: “Nelson”
Reviews.Author: Nelson35790
Reviews.Content: The service at the W was excellent. Being a Platinum SPG member, I was always upgraded to a suite. The ambiance was always warm and comforting. The outside restaurant and pool were very relaxing. Being close to UCLA, the community was very youthful and upbeat. A great variety of restaurants to choose from. Stayed at the W 6 times and have never been disappointed. Breakfast staff was very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite W hotel”
Reviews.Author: DougCA
Reviews.Content: I've been lucky to stay at many of the W hotels around the world and this one is my favorite. I've stayed several times, for several weeks and it's always the best. Despite being in LA, Westwood is a pretty suburban and the hotel is in a fairly quiet neighborhood with lots of trees. There is natural wood in the construction and it's a low-profile building, not a high-rise. The rooms are all beautiful, I've been upgraded to big suites a few times and they are amazing, but almost too much room for what I need, just the regular room is huge and fantastic. The staff is great, grounds beautiful, definitely a peaceful place. Only downer is that if you (or friends) are street-parking types, it's all permit parking n the area and pretty much impossible to street park so you need to valet or risk a lightning-quick parking ticket. I'm not a hard-core club-going type that likes the W hotels that are also popular nightclubs, so this place is just my style - classy, modern and quiet, yet understated. My favorite Starwood property.

Reviews.Title: “W = Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Matt T
Reviews.Content: I love the W Westwood. All the rooms are suites and everyone is very friendly. I was lucky enough to be upgraded to a Fabulous Suite and also to be checked in by a beautiful girl named Jenny. I hope you share the same great experience I had at the W Westwood.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: jcjd2000
Reviews.Content: I love the location - right on a sleepy street in Westwood close to UCLA. The staff is always really nice, although you may have to dress up to hang out in the lobby... pretty hip after the sun goes down! Guest rooms are really comfortable - and spacious. It's a little like they converted an office building, and ceilings are a little low, but W bed is SO amazing. Bonus is the Bliss products in the bathroom!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jaymaxx
Reviews.Content: Located in a residential area. Can walk to town and UCLA. Very nice rooms, service and restaurants. Pool area is also very nice. Has parking lot underneath hotel which is good because it is hard to park on street.

Reviews.Title: “W Hotel--The Best”
Reviews.Author: GlobeTrottersUnite
Reviews.Content: We were attending a medical conference at UCLA and wanted to be close to campus! The W Hotel not only was close but provided the hip ambiance that you would want if you are Westwood, Beverly Hills or LA!! It's welcoming contemporary lobby is over the top with many sitting areas for conversation or working on your lap top The pool area, gym, restaurant and internet area is tastefully done!! We were upgraded to a SUITE that was practical and artistically designed to accommodate late evenings guests. The W Hotel also provides complimentary morning coffee...a big bonus... The BEST was the STAFF and CONCIERGE that made everyone feel welcome and were most warm and friendly. I would come back here in a heart beat...

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel. Amazing service!”
Reviews.Author: Brookestar11
Reviews.Content: Great rooms! Great people. The breakfast wrap is amazing if you have breakfast in the restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Hip Hotel next to UCLA”
Reviews.Author: TunaSlayer
Reviews.Content: This is a fun place to stay. It has all the hip, fun little features that you find at a W Hotel. The food and drink service was good. We got the upgraded fun suite and lot's of space. You could easily sleep 5-6 people in the three room suite we were provided. Concierge was helpful, front desk friendly and the bartenders were seasoned. The only problem we had was quickly fixed and we were comped the meal for our trouble. Not cheap but a great experience. If you want to save money stay at the airport. If you want to have fun, have a great time stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel, but rooms need darkening blinds!”
Reviews.Author: splianka
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay in the hotel. It has two rooms, a living area/tv/desk/minibar and the bedroom. The bathroom is quite large and comfortable. The staff was very friendly. The mini-bar wasn't any pricier than any other mini-bar and had a decent selection. The indoor restaurant/bar was really quite nice for both breakfast and late night drinks. I had only a few issues. The bedroom needs room darkening blinds! They had very nice shutters that did nothing to block out the light. I ALWAYS wake with the light, so this sort of sucked. The bathroom needed *more* light. Although there was a lighted make-up mirror and additional lights- none of the bathroom lights seemed strong enough. I DETEST overhead lights outside of a bathroom, but I actually welcome the option of good overhead lighting in the bath. It was simply a bit dark. The neighborhood was fairly low-key, right near UCLA and some neighborhood restaurants, residential areas etc. If I was in the area, I would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Westwood Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Evi_02
Reviews.Content: Great place to stay if viewing UCLA campus, or want a close location to Westwood, Santa Monica, Brentwood. The rooms were very big. It is located right by Westwood on the bottom of Sorority Road. You can walk to Westwood and the UCLA campus. The rooms have a delightful livingroom like area, with the bedroom in the back, also a work station for computers. I nice pool, and everyone is so friendly. Has valet parking, but also a parking a garage kitty corner just in case....... would definitely stay here again. Oh bliss products in the rooms, very nice. You can walk to Westwood, they have everything there that you could need.

Reviews.Title: “Bring Eye Mask & Ear Plugs to Sleep”
Reviews.Author: SunshineGirl2929
Reviews.Content: Once you pass the glitz of the W, you'll notice the halls and rooms are getting tired and are ready for an update. Sleeping was not comfortable. The windows were covered with plantation shutters without light blocking shades, so a lot of sunlight came into my room. I had to wear an eyemask. Plus, sounds from nearby rooms came through the walls and vents. I had to wear ear plugs. There was no digital alarm clock in the room - just an analog clock with a small face that was hard to see at night. HVAC made grinding noises. Fitness center was crampt with low ceilings, which made my workout a little depressing. Nonetheless, my room was generously sized and I liked the large vanity table in the bathroom to spread out my toiletries. Bliss toiletries provided, very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good suites, so-so business services, funny tween girls”
Reviews.Author: Big_Foof
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W because it was the most convenient in the vicinity for a business trip that offered the meeting facilites we needed. The suites are big and comfortable. Good beds, good showers, etc. The business side is a bit iffy. We told them we needed to stream video to someone, for which they charged a substantial fee. The meeting rooms were large enough and comfortable enough, but the lighting is somewhat dim. I can only guess that hangovers and dissipated appearances dictate soft low lighting? But the necessary arrangements were not in place at the appointed hour. Little things that require minimal investment, like high speed printing and copying, are not on offer and there is no real business center. But I must say the conference catering was quite good. Another letdown was slow elevator service in the early morning because on lift is used for freight service. Not a good thing at a busy time for us. Overall, service was better than average, but somewhat irregular. On the bright side, some boy band was staying there, so we were treated to the spectacle of screeching, rampaging tween girls which added some high humor to the visit.

Reviews.Title: “Not the best but a lot better than most of the rest”
Reviews.Author: NYtravelbird5912
Reviews.Content: Pros: Humungous suites, on premises Bliss Spa staff, expert concierge, sweet large HD televisions, unstuffy to the max Cons: Room service food has sharply declined over last year (get a new menu for heaven's sake), the new gym is so-so, the location is only good for UCLA, what's with the room service trays not being picked up in the hallways? Maybe I've stayed here too many times in the last three years, but I'm getting less and less enamored with this W property. All Ws are heavy on gimmicks (a cam in the elevator that displays your image), a Whenever-Whatever service that is highly dubious (it gets you the usual stuff a hotel can get you, hardly anything unexpected) and bathrooms that look spiffy and hip but are actually kind of uncomfortable (shower heads that pummel you with tiny high-pressured arrows of water and counters that hold a toothbrush and not much more). As long as you've never stayed at a W before, you may not mind these things, but after the 5th or 6th visit, the gimmicks lose their charm, the inconveniences are glaring, and the food is so lousy you'll be able to swan around like all the other underfed guests.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: wes74
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W Los Angeles - Westwood for 1 night in January 2012. This was my first visit to this W and I was very impressed. From the outside the hotel doesn't look like anything special, but the inside is fantastic. As a Starwood Platinum member I was upgraded to one of their suites which was a great perk. This room was HUGE and I really felt like home. The decor was very modern and upscale, the W beds are some of the most comfortable in the hotel world, and the bathrooms were awesome. This hotel has so much to offer and I only wish I could have stayed for more than 1 night. They have a large outdoor pool, a great fitness center, and the service is second to none. Oh and their elevators are so much fun, it's like being in one of those photo booths. Like any full service hotel they will nickel and dime you to death unless you have status (in this case with Starwood). Valet parking is $35 per night and is really the only option available. The hotel is located in a very safe area with several shops and restaurants within walking distance. I would love to stay here again the next time I return to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Must-Stay”
Reviews.Author: J G
Reviews.Content: Had a wonderful experience. Their staff was extremely polite and helpful, and the Group Sales personnel (Ryan, Beena, & Amy) was amazing in helping out with every detail. Great location surrounded by many restaurants, the UCLA campus, and other emenities that our group raved about. The rooms were spacious and the work out area/pool was gorgeous. A must stay if you are in the area.

Reviews.Title: “This W rocks”
Reviews.Author: Matt O
Reviews.Content: Had such a great long weekend with some great friends and this W was our base Groovy cameras in the lifts, close to Venice and Sanat Monica beaches and great outside bar and pool; if you have not been hooked by a W yet, this one will do the trick. Everything that the actual Hollywood W isn't.

Reviews.Title: “Despite the exterior, the hotel is lovely inside”
Reviews.Author: yankeetravels27
Reviews.Content: When I walked up from around the block I have to admit I was worried. The hotel looks like an old 1970's apartment building with Ivy growing on it. But as soon as you approach the hotel the doormen great you and take your bags inside to a swank lobby. I stayed in a Queen suite, which was spacious, nice bathroom with a living room and separate bedroom, you almost felt like you were in an apartment. The gym was more than adequate with 5 treadmills, several elliptical machines, and free weights. I didn't dine in the restaurants or bars, but it is a Randy Gerber bar so it is swanky and does attract a local crowd. It was a bit chilly when I was there so the pool and backyard grill were not open, but from my room I could see they were quite expansive and probably great to hang out in on a warm day/night. Walking distance to UCLA medical center and university. Overall, good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Badly worn and in need of renovating”
Reviews.Author: nancy g
Reviews.Content: Checking in was a nightmare but we booked through hotels.com and not sure who was at fault. Skipping that scenario-we checked into a "fabulous" suite. It was not fabulous in anyway. There was water damage in the bathroom; a magnifying mirror on the wall in which a huge area of the mirror had been scraped off-looked like a big wad of black gum was stuck to it. There were also stains on the couch in the sitting area. We chose the fabulous suite because we traveled with our son so wanted a separate bed area. The fold out couch was years old with a thin mattress laid over uncomfortable springs..like a fold out cot from the 50's. My husband and I had a drink the lounge/bar. The sofa we sat on was not just thread bare-it had tears all throughout. The other furniture in the lounge was in as bad a shape....shredded and stained fabrics-quite disgusting. The outside area in the back near the pool had cigarette butts on the ground along with bits of garbage. At checkout our buill showed double charges for Wifi use (which they corrected) and charges for parking which had been included in our rate (this may have been hotels.com fault). Those charges were ultimately corrected.

Reviews.Title: “Fab service, great room decor”
Reviews.Author: SFMom
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights on an SPG reward. I was upgraded to a corner suite and I could not believe the size and great decor of the room -- if modern is your style you will like it, though I did see the review where someone found the furniture uncomfortable. The lobby has the dark W thing going on, as does the room, so you have to turn on all the lights, but when you do you are not disappointed. The lounge has seen better days with a little fraying here and there, but we wanted to check out the club at the W Hollywood and we felt totally taken care of by the concierge. Not sure of the full price rates, but I was very happy here - thank you for the great service, from the front desk to the concierge to maintenance, etc! What I did not like was the very expensive WiFi - was not clear it was not included...over $30 for less than 3 days...Also enjoyed many hours of services in the Bliss Spa on site...another benefit!

Reviews.Title: “Some good things, some bad things.”
Reviews.Author: 5heartfamily
Reviews.Content: This W is located in a good area, with good access to LA. It's modern lobby decor is accented with beautiful edgy fresh flower arrangements and comfortable places to sit. However, the suites are done in 50's retro modern, and the furnishings - especially the living room couch - are really uncomfortable. Also, it seems that everyone has trouble with the elevator / room key system, that is supposed to provide security, but often keeps you from getting to your floor! Further, the Wi-Fi connection is only free in the lobby, not in your room. The pool, which was converted into a fake-ice skating rink during our stay (cute for little kids), has lovely landscaping, and would be enjoyable when the pool is available.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: cls85
Reviews.Content: I stayed using my SPG Points with my girlfriend for a one night getaway. The hotel is amazing and beautiful. The room was great, nice size suite. The only complaints I would have is when trying to call down to reach the operator took a more than a couple of minutes for them to answer the phone. Also when I was at the bar having a cocktail when it was slow, the girls at the bar would be texting and talking with each other. Which is alright except when I'm trying to order a drink after finishing a cocktail.. Kudos to the valet driver who when I was leaving asked if I would like a bottle of water when leaving the hotel. I will come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Cool W hotel”
Reviews.Author: Vacationtime79
Reviews.Content: I have spent 3 nights at the W Hotel in Los Angeles at the end of December 2011 with my fiance. Overall, I really enjoyed staying at the W in LA. Location: Westwood is a nice neighborhood, close to all tourist attractions but the area is pretty residential. There is a Trader Joe's and a Starbucks nearby - although the hotel has a complimentary coffee and tea in the morning. We book a promotional deal where the valet parking was included. I strongly recommend valet parking. Room: It was more like a suite. We were given on the 12th floor and the bedroom was separate from a small leaving room/area. It looked really nice and the W has a special "cool" style. Gym: It is a small room but has all the essentials. Even though I am happy with the W because of its "cool" vibe, here is some deficiencies: 1) We experienced some miserable service at the restaurant - maybe it is because we got served by the bar tender but he was just a pretty bad waiter. But I will discuss that in a separate review. 2) Upon checking in, we went back to the reception area and asked for a bar of soap and slippers. Now, normally, there is a soap to wash your hands in the bathroom. It is such a basic necessity but somehow was forgotten. It is also nice to get slippers to use in the bathroom. When we asked at the reception desk, he just handed them to us. I would have expected that he has them sent to our room. 3) Elevator in the middle - supposed to work if you "properly" insert your room card. But it never worked with our cards in the three days we stayed there so we just used the other elevators where you don't have to insert your room card. I would recommend the W and would love to return again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and close to the Getty museum!”
Reviews.Author: loveslife03
Reviews.Content: Our suite was beautiful......perfect for two of us. We were fortunate to get a great rate that week and we enjoyed walking from the hotel to Westwood especially in the morning. I lived there in the early seventies.......now not as charming and the well known restaurants were no longer there. The hotel staff were terrific and we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Spent 2 days for a family celebration”
Reviews.Author: alandsa
Reviews.Content: We had 4 rooms--three spectacular and one fabulous room. The rooms were a nice size and well appointed. However, one room was not cleaned at all, one partially cleaned. After calling the manager on call, they delivered soap to the room that wasn't cleaned at all but no clean towels. Very disappointing level of service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Property, Dated Furniture/Rooms”
Reviews.Author: mgeolina
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in a nice area. This is an all-suite hotel meaning all rooms are actual suite ranging from jr. to reg size. I have SPG Platinum and I've been upgraded to a corner one-bedroom suite which is very nice and private. It has a living room you can actually hang out in with a nice layout, flatscreens and audio hooks. It actually also has a den with a pull-out sleeper couch which I've never used. Comfortable SPG beds. Good Room service quality, delivery time OK. Staff helpful mostly. Need to have more spare ipod/iphone/ipad chargers for the forgetful guests considering what town and part of that town you're in. Having said that, renovations are in order as the furniture is getting old.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Rooms, Awesome Service!”
Reviews.Author: jerca
Reviews.Content: Stay here you won't regret it. Very nice 2 bedroom suites, restaurant and bar were very good. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Husband didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: Cecille M
Reviews.Content: This venue was chosen for an event and we couldn't have been happier with everything! From the service to the room accomodations everything was perfect. Tiffany at the front desk (I think that was her name) was the perfect blend of "efficient yet thorough". The suite was spacious, clean and comfortable. I popped my ipod into their sound system and got ready with my favorite music to put me in a party mood. Our Event was held in The Backyard and the servers were excellent. I didn't get brave enough to skate on the ice rink that they had over their pool for the winter, but it looked like fun! My husband was so comfortable there he insisted we eat breakfast in our suite and stay until the very last minute for check out. I've stayed at several W Hotels for business -- New York Union Square, San Diego, Chicago Lakeshore but this one is my favorite even though it is close to home. Can't wait until my next stay at the W in Westwood!

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for more!”
Reviews.Author: Mom_with_five
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this property last week for a quick trip to attend a movie premiere. Since I didn't pick the lodging I didn't know what to expect. The accomodations were fantastic. Very comfortable room, beautifully decorated. Flat screen TVs in both the living area and the bedroom. Beds were comfortable. The desk area was large enough for two people to sit there which isn't always the case in some rooms. Only thing I can think of to add is that an exhaust fan in the bathroom might be nice to have. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The only exception might have been the young lady who sat us for breakfast. She was a bit standoffish. The desk staff always greeted you as you walked through. The concierge staff was friendly and helped with any questions or arrangements needed. The bell staff outside was also friendly and gave us a few tips on venues within walking distance to visit while we were out. The most fun my daughter had was the "photo booth" feature in the elevator. Kept her endlessly entertained!

Reviews.Title: “Fun Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kevin k
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is so much fun to stay at! Great night life and fun atmosphere! Will be back

Reviews.Title: “A Wilshire Corridor Gem”
Reviews.Author: KaliKross
Reviews.Content: Take your dream resort, the hotels you've seen in glossy magazines, and the Lifestyles of the People-Who-Aren't-You images. Take everything that made you acutely aware of how common you were and lather on a cream too rich to afford. Welcome to the W, Westwood. Subtly perched on a hill just below Sunset and within walking distance to UCLA, the hotel is a deliberate venue. You're unlikely to happen upon it, and it hasn't the "Hey, look at me!" glitz that the W in Hollywood airs. People are mellow here. They act "normal", unlike the posers who want everyone to think they're "somebody", the conspicuously insecure types, prowling around the lobby at the W, Hollywood. Most people here appear on business or on vacation. The men don't hide their wedding bands, and the women aren't all model wannabes. However, the Sunday pool parties and other public events (like the Friday and Saturday night club) are crashed by the broke but beautiful. As a parent, I like that the hotel draws families. Many mums and dads tote toddlers, and the pool is packed with t(w)eenie boppers, splashing about. However, the hotel couldn't be further from family-oriented. Children aren't allowed to "indulge" in any of the W's activities or even sit on the sofas in the lounge because they are associated with the bar, Whiskey Blue. In fact, the only place kids can be present outside of their rooms is in The Backyard, the pool area. Who wants to dine while inhaling chlorine every day? The only thing I didn't like about the pool setup is that unoccupied cabanas aren't available to guests without a $150 ransom. Here, you will bake under the SoCal sun or pay the cabana premium because there aren't even any umbrellas by the pool. Activity restrictions aside, the rooms make this W a gem. Hilltop views to the left; Wilshire Corridor views to the right. The "Fabulous" suite is basically a two-bedroom apartment without a kitchen. There is a living room, a bedroom, a wet bar, and an office with a pullout sofa. So far, this ranks as my favorite W, if for the suite features alone. ;-) P.S. Valet if you will, but there's plenty on-street parking right out front.

Reviews.Title: “Ultra-hip decor and style; Service unfortunately bordered between indifferent (at best) to rude (at worst)”
Reviews.Author: travelinlight58
Reviews.Content: This hotel had everything you would expect from a W Hotel. Modern decor. Hip bar and restaurant. Lots of cool little features. The room was great. Very stylish, very cool. However the staff members were so bad, and so rude at times that it brings my overall rating down. First, I have stayed in my share of hotels in NY and LA. I understand the difference between being curt/efficient and being aloof and rude. The W in Westwood was clearly the latter. Every request was a chore. I wanted to make sure my Starwood number was in the reservation, so after I was handed the keys I asked them to check that (they did not confirm that it was in the reservation, which is standard). I got an audible sigh, a roll of the eyes, and a begrudging response. This went on, and on. It wasn't just one employee ... it was almost every employee I interacted with. Very disappointing. If you aren't going to talk to any staff and don't mind this kind of behavior, then the W is great for its decor and modern look. If you expect service with a smile (or at least without a smirk), I would look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “good a bit far from all major attractions in LA”
Reviews.Author: ChefMairaIsabel
Reviews.Content: Hotel is beautiful and staff could not be more amazing! I was told the pool is where the scene from the pool from Pretty Woman was shoot at. Location is my only real complain. Its about 10 -15 minutes from major attractions in LA. If you don't mind this, its a great hotel. Parking is not cheap at $38 per night, but employees are amazing and my car was ready every time.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Beautiful Hotel, But Check Your Bill CAREFULLY!”
Reviews.Author: GhostHuntingDiva
Reviews.Content: The hotel was clean, modern, and beautiful. Our suite was spacious, clean, and was very stylish. My only issue with this hotel was after we checked out. The day we checked out, I received an email copy of my charges. Everything was fine, no problems. The day after that, I received another email but this time there was some random mini bar charge. We never touched the mini bar. Seriously, I'm not going to pay $5 for a bag of chips when I can walk down the street and get the same thing for a buck. In any case, I called the hotel and disputed the charges. They refunded the charge but it just shows that you should always check your bills & receipts carefully!!

Reviews.Title: “Overall a pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Sheba31
Reviews.Content: After a disappointing stay at a crap serviced apartment inMalibu, the W was indeed a welcome to end our 10 week trip around the USA. I stayed here with my husband and 2 toddlers. The Spectacular Corner Suite we booked  was lovely, spacious, clean and tastefully  decorated. The bed was really comfortable. My only gripe is that the bathroom was small and could do with some drawers for toiletries. The bench space was not enough. I thought the showerhead looked a bit cheap but no complaints as the water pressure was good. I did note that the were no coffee/tea making facilities in the room but these are complimnetary at the ninethirty restaurant downstairs. Our corner room was nice and quiet. Staff here, particularly Kathrine (concierge) and Gary (doorman) were ever so obliging. Our 1 year old was really ill so she organised a few numbers for me to call and had the Accura complimentary car, take us to our chosen physician in Santa Monica. Gary organised to have our broken stroller repaired by the hotel's engineerng department. We did have trouble with a request for a microwave oven, needed to heat up our toddlers' meals and milk. When i made the booking, i spoke with reservation and told her it was imperative that we had one and that i would book a room based on whether we could get one. They said we could but when we arrived, i was told there wasnt one available but we would get the first one that became available. One did later that evening but  quickly discovered that it was faulty. A call to them sent engineering to come and take a look at it and wasnt able to fix it. In the mean time, they sent a kettle which was fine. The next day, I had to call again to say no one had since been up to repair or replace the microwave. We had breakfast the first morning we were there. Offerings were good but a little pricey as with room service. Poolside restaurant was good and they staff were really friendly. Found the kids menu a little too pricey compared to other hotels. We were looking forward to taking out kids to the pool one day but it was closed for a photoshoot. The next day, we found that the pool wasnt heated and the cabanas were being cleaned so that was a disappointment. Had a blissful treatment at the Bliss Spa on level 2. This is a must do for any stay at the W. Be su to partake in the complimentary brownies in the lounge. Location is not bad. Near Ralphs, Trader Joes and Wholefoods if you need groceries. Short drive to Century City and Beverly Hills shopping. Note that valet is $35 a night. We booked online and there was package that included parking and 2 sip tickets for cocktails. It would have been the same price for the room only. We had a rental car that we had only the first night of our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Room furniture is worn down and needs updating”
Reviews.Author: Suntory65
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the 'Spectacular Suite' over the weekend. I'm giving this hotel an average rating because for the price you pay to stay here, you'd expect the furniture in the suite to be in overall better condition. Here are the main pros and cons: Pros: Modern hotel with beautiful lobby, bar, and outdoor area Great staff and bathroom amenities Room service food is delicious Suite is roomy with TV in living room and bedroom Comfortable bed Cons: Furniture (mirror on walls, sofa, carpet) in the suite is old and worn down. The sofa cushions were unraveling at the seams. Thin walls / doors - can hear people slamming their doors all night and day In-room WIFI is not free (however I was able to use the Lobby WIFI in the room that allows 1 day free) Overnight parking is $35.

Reviews.Title: “The W Westwood - Stands for "WOW"”
Reviews.Author: ATBster
Reviews.Content: In and out for a quick business meeting, overnight from NYC en route to Boston. This place is fabulous. Wonderfully accommodating staff, hi-tech rooms with all the latest. Plenty of plugs. Great wifi connectivity. Quiet, comfortable. I can't say enough about this new (to me) Starwood Preferred Guest hotel. I'll be back... ATBster

Reviews.Title: “Very average and bad value for money”
Reviews.Author: sydneyberlin
Reviews.Content: It's all a bit sad really: I had stayed at the Andaz up on Sunset the week earlier and compared to that incredibly great experience the W Westwood really is a whole big let down. The issues, however, seem to be going on chain-wide as several of my last stays at Ws had been quite disappointing. You know something is wrong if at every single property of the chain you are staying at, you'll witness unhappy customers at reception arguing about issues they've encountered. Was the same here and I'm not surprised: The staff seem helplessly overworked, far too few people man the reception and there is hardly ever anyone at the concierge desk. Hence you can literally feel how unhappy and disengaged everyone is which shows in the service provided. Just a few examples were the Accura service which offers the last drive out at 5:15 (who needs it so well before dinner?) and then has an unshaven, hardly speaking driver- I remember that being much better from a few years back. Other usual issue was late check out but then getting the key cut only till noon. As a result I was standing in my bathrobe coming from the pool with water dripping from me at reception, no one caring and making me wait for ages. Then having the guts to ask me for ID! Good joke. Ah and the "Whatever whenever" as in almost all W hotels these days totally overpromised: Tried once, no one picked up. Tried twice, person on other end totally stressed and trying to get rid of you as fast as possible. Property itself also a total disappointment: Besides the horrid location (in the middle of no where next to a uni campus, 25 bucks plus for a cab ride each way to get to Hollywood or West Hollywood), the building is an old and ugly concrete block that clearly shows its age. Pool in reality is muuuch smaller than shown on their website and worst of it all, the walls throughout the building are paper thin and most guests seem to be teens and twens who share (officially or inofficially) share their rooms with three four others in order to afford them and then make use of that by partying all night- very classy. Bathrooms have simple stuck to the wall shower heads and come with a yuck old shower curtain (!), like in one of those mouldy hotels from the 80ies. All in all an utter disappointment, cancelled my upcoming trip in March straight away and instead booked with the competition. If you're staying in the area, I would recommend the Andaz in West Hollywood or the Rennaissance up on Hollywood Boulevard- both offer better service than the W, are usually cheaper even and definitely are located better. What a waste of money the W is.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, quiet, love it”
Reviews.Author: Debbiestravels
Reviews.Content: Great poolside restaurant, love the area - am there on business but like being near Century City which I think is the best outdoor shopping mall. I stay here when I can and when the rates are lower. Starwood Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best staff ever!!”
Reviews.Author: Meredith G
Reviews.Content: Shin from Wheels is the best!! Also, Elizabeth at the front desk is SO great!! Everyone on staff is very friendly and helpful. I travel here 2 weeks out of the month for work and they all make my travel experience very easy.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: MissME3
Reviews.Content: Nice and peaceful. I came here with some friends one night and the service was great. The staff are friendly, the pool was very fun and the rooms are nice and large.

Reviews.Title: “A horrible stay”
Reviews.Author: calstars
Reviews.Content: Sent my wife to W for a getaway weekend. The drains in the bathroom were clogged (oddly this happened to us two years ago at same property - shame on us for going back). The maintenance man then showed up the next day at 8 am without warning to fix the problem. The pastries at the coffee bar were covered with ants - not appetizing. The room was unfortunately placed over the bass speaker for the nightclub as the thumping lasted till 2 am. No warning given by the staff at checkin. So much for a relaxing weekend. Next time we will book somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property and Location in LA”
Reviews.Author: Natsfandc
Reviews.Content: Great location, courteous staff, well maintained property, beautiful rooms and great pool equals an unparralleled experience. Have stayed here for both work and leisure and highly recommend for both purposes.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful W Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dailynada
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at this wonderful property. There is so much to love about this place--the service, the super comfy and plush rooms, the gym, and the fantastic outdoor restaurant. We had great drinks and bar snacks and the setting by the pool, is wonderful. We also love the location-feels like a little oasis in this major metropolis. If there was one negative though, I would have to say valet parking is pretty pricey--but then again it is L.A. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great service”
Reviews.Author: ARS819
Reviews.Content: Excellent customer service. Very large comfortable suites.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: leoedward
Reviews.Content: Great hotel nestled near UCLA. This hotel does a great job with a unique location. The pool area is great, the room service awesome. It's my favorite hotel in Los Angeles. Very helpful staff.

Reviews.Title: “re: love it”
Reviews.Author: kitty-hello
Reviews.Content: Everything was nice, from decor, services, restaurants, bar, drinks, pool and the room!! Only thing is the steep cost for either valet or overnight parking.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we were expecting from a W property”
Reviews.Author: Japan_Expat_07
Reviews.Content: This must be the exception to the rule. This hotel is not on par with the quality of other high end hotels that the W competes against. The furnishings look like they are a product of the "design on a dime" team at HGTV. Bulky, white painted 70's wood furniture, massive dated hardware that looks like it belongs in a dungeon, and a fiberglass bathtub you'd find at any Holiday Inn, and plumbing that you can hear working several rooms away. Not sure what this building was before it became a hotel, but they really missed the boat. Simply put, the quality of construction and amenities is crap. Natural lighting on most of the rooms that face the interior of this "H" shaped building is terrible, and compounded by plantation shutters that don't match the chic-esq decor that the hotel tries to project. In the morning, the plumbing is so loud it woke us up. Adding to the negative vibe here is that there stress having everything you want, many things that most hotels offer, like an in-room coffee machine do not exist. I don't want to have to get dressed to get my first cup of joe in the morning, nor do I want to pay $8 for it either. In a day and age when most hotels comp internet to their frequent visitors, the W charges. I stay at a lot of SPG properties and haven't had to pay in a long time, until now. On the positive side, the staff is very friendly and helpful. While self parking is not practical in this area of Westwood, there are plenty of attendants to help you.

Reviews.Title: “Great room and location”
Reviews.Author: JChen368
Reviews.Content: Had a good experience at the W in Los Angeles Westwood. Rooms are quite large and well-maintained. Brunch was good at the Backyard, however they are not friendly to pets. Made us tie the dog at the bottom of a hill even though other customers around us didn't mind (actually wanted to play with him too!)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with large rooms and great service”
Reviews.Author: dottie dog
Reviews.Content: I was in this hotel 2 nights for business and found the service to be excellent, the rooms large, clean and well appointed. The separate desk area made it easy for work and kept that clutter away from bedroom or tv area. The bar was nice, and had quick coffee and breakfast option. I didn't have time to use the spa or pool unfortunately. Great hotel with very friendly and efficient staff.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome place for business and pleasure ...”
Reviews.Author: Indrajit
Reviews.Content: Travelled with wife and 2 kids, 2 years old. I had written to the manager requesting an upgrade - I was given a room with one bedroom and 2 (yes, 2) living areas. We were provided with champagne and the strawberries and even bath toys for the boys – very thoughtful !!! The concierge is great and the location superb. Not far from anywhere ... the parking attendants very helpful as well. One minus is the food - could have been better for the price.

Reviews.Title: “excellent follow up service cures pain”
Reviews.Author: rhonda s
Reviews.Content: For 6 nights I stayed in the mega suite for its bathtub due to surgery on my back. For 5 of those nights, the bathtub has not worked. I complained, and the engineers tried to fix the stopper, but admitted that it was fair at best. Tonight, JOE in engineering said that he would find the stopper that would work and replace this one by noon. He was kind, considerate and efficient. I would have hoped that this problem would have been solved for me to use the tub prior evenings. 2 out of 6 nights was not really what I was looking for in an upgrade that I paid for. Joe, the engineer soothed my aggrevation and kept me as a customer. I am not thrilled at the lack of use during my stay for something desparately needed, but I am hopeful this will never happen again because of JOE!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: layla317
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the W. It was located perfectly for our visit to UCLA. The unique location was in a residential area immediately adjacent to lively Westwood Village and close to the bustle of Wilshire Boulevard. I loved the "walkability" of it. The rooms and common areas were artistically designed with deco/modern style furnishings but they accomplished a warm, welcoming feel that many such decors do not. The room, a small suite, was spacious, comfortable and highly functional as living quarters away from home. One surprising omission was that there was not coffee/tea service available in the room. The pool area was lovely and lively. Workout facilities were good. We did not sample the restaurants. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Happy Business Traveler!”
Reviews.Author: ladymisskate
Reviews.Content: I am in Los Angeles every other week for work and exclusively stay at the W in Westwood, not only because it is close to my meetings but also because the hotel staff is extremely helpful and friendly. Shin who works in the valet remembered my name by my second stay and hes always very quick to get my car and offer a bottle of water for the day! Business travel is tough and being greeted by friendly hotel employees makes a huge difference. Thanks guys!

Reviews.Title: “PLEASE READ !!!!! This review was WELL Earned”
Reviews.Author: Michael E
Reviews.Content: I have been an SPG member for 9 yrs and a Platinum member for over 7yrs (over 200 nites a year) so i would like to think i am qualified to give a precise and accurate review...why i didnt do this sooner is beyond me but here i am now :) Of all the SPG brands i prefer the W 1st and of all the W's "Worldwide" (yes i have been to most) .. i would rate the W in Westwood the best ... what they may lack in Luxery amenities (sorry no Phantom waiting or Butler at your beckon call) they more than make up for in EVERYTHING else...the rooms are all spacious and very comfy...bright colors..and most importantly everything works...and if it doesnt it will after one phone call....from their Welcome Ambassador that will greet you most times by name when you arrive to a very effecient check in and a world class "Whatever Whenever" (yes they really mean that) i guarantee that you will not find anything or anyone in the W Staff lacking...i am a bit partial because at one time i lived there when 1st moving to LA but even if i wasnt a Platinum SPG or a known regular the service would still be the same because everyone from the GM to the maids or wheel is there to help make your stay memorable...even if it is not their job that you are asking them to do... And "if" by chance you may have a complaint or be dissatisfied with any part of your visit, you will never have to go thru a myraid of buffers to get to someone that will actually care...just pick up the phone and even the GM would make himself personally available to address your concerns.... Now about the spa .. I am there with my Fiance about once a week and we would NEVER go anywhere else...service is outstanding and staff is impeccably trained...its a very cool place even just to hang out and eat the brownies :) The pool....hhhmmm ... all i can say is watch "Entourage"...yes it is the same pool and it is just that fun...people watching is the order of the day if you can find a cabana open or a lounger that doesnt already have someone beautiful already getting sun... The food is great with awesome variety...whether its on the Patio...the lobby restaurant or just plain old room service...you cant go wrong... well i think that this covers all i have been wanting to say for the past few years....one last note...I have lived about 10 miles from the W Westwood for a few years now, but i dont let that stop me from staying there 3-4 nites a month... thats how much like family they have become to me :) Ssssooo go, visit, endulge, enjoy....and i promise....you will return again :)

Reviews.Title: “Water leak from bathroom to living room”
Reviews.Author: RilakkumaSeattle
Reviews.Content: We stayed there two night in the summer, and I swim a lot so I took 3-4 shower per day in there. After I had a long shower, I walked out the bathroom and found out that the carpet outside out the bathtub wall is kinda wet. And I thought it was my feet wet or I made the bathroom floor wet(I use the bath curtain properply!) so I wipe my feet and try to feel the carpet with my hand, the carpet is So wet and the bathroom floor isn't. So I call the table downstair and they sent someone to look at it. After all, they said it is due to I shower too looooong!! I meant... What the hell reason is that? A customer shower tooo looong will make the water from the bath tube leak to the living room carpet? Oh my god I cant believe this.

Reviews.Title: “Lovin' the W!”
Reviews.Author: Gabi07
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent time in Los Angeles to attend the Prime Time Emmy Award Show. We stayed at the W in Westwood for the first time.. but certainly it wasn't our last time! We loved it for a number of reasons, such as the location, the service, the furnishing and spaciousness of the rooms etc. etc. The location is great! It's just around the corner from the Wilshire Boulevard, Beverly Hills, Century City, Rodeo Drive etc. etc. The service is incredibe.. consistently across the hotel! The valet guys who also help with the luggage are so friendly and helpful. The concierge managed to get a limo for us to take us to the Emmy's. This was all very short notice and not only did she manage to find someone, she also had a tasty sweet platter delivered to our room that night wishing us a nice day at the Emmy's. Amazing! The guys at the check in were great, too! We needed to store some luggage for a week in the W whilst we were travelling elsewhere in the US and it was no problem at all. Even better, when we came back and checked in again, our stored luggage was quickly delivered to our room. Fab! We had a chance to try the 930 restaurant, too. The food (and again the service) was great. The gym is decent. We could only take a look at the pool area, which is stunning and very inviting, but unfortunately we were running out of time. Well, we'll be back in L.A. and definitely will stay at the W Westwood again! Thank you, Team of the W, for making this stay such a memorable experience!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: jdr27
Reviews.Content: The W Westwood follows a common W model of taking an old property, in this case a drab 1970s looking concrete monolith (which they cleverly don't show you on their website) and converting it to a hip, stylish fun place to stay. In this case they deliver on a few things but miss the mark on most. Most of the problems relate to design and upkeep, starting with the fact that the hallways and room smelled old and musty throughout our stay. I brought this to the attention of whatever/whenever who could only have housekeeping 'spray', which didn't solve the problem. The problem could likely be solved by being able to open the small windows in the room, but maintenance claimed that they could only be opened by four inches, hence there is little if any fresh air in the rooms. Speaking of windows, the exterior windows were absolutely filthy, looked liked they haven't been washed in years. The windows are small to begin with, allow little light in the rooms, and they have these overly large shutters on the inside of the windows. Combine inability to open windows with dirty, small windows and you have a room that smells stale. Old windows are also not double glazed and the room was noisy - we heard traffic , pool noise, gardeners working all day and night despite being mid-lvel in a largely residential neighborhood. Bathroom was disproportionally small compared to the room itself, had only a single sink with very little counter space and nowhere to store toiletries. Tub/shower was standard (small) and with non-hygenic creepy shower curtain that stuck to you while shower was on. Wood veneer was fraying off bathroom door, grout was moldy and there was no exhaust fan in bathroom. Other than that, the West Elm inspired hipster room with funky decor was ok. Pool area was pleasant enough, but furniture was shabby, lounges torn and stained and the pool itself wasn't the infinity variety one would expect in a hip boutique hotel in LA. It seemed like the old pool from whatever the property was before W took over. Only positive I can think of was a friendly staff, who were always eager to help. I personally think W needs a strong dose of quality control and this property could use some management attention.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre Hotel with trendy aspirations that fails to deliver.”
Reviews.Author: FrancisDavid
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights. I travel extensively (globally) and have normally loved W hotels. Not this one. Place looks great, but they clearly don't keep it in good condition. I have never written a review before, but I felt very strongly that others should know. Here are a few highlights: air con controls did not work, so only way to control room temp was to turn off completely then wake up and turn on, then off, etc. First morning order breakfast, and they send wrong order (not a big deal, happens) but the coffee mug they give me had dirt, old oatmeal and lip stick stains. I send back. They bring me a new pot (but no cup). Hmmm. Come back to room second evening after all day meetings, and room had not been cleaned. I was told short staffed--really, on the busiest weekend in LA with the Emmys? Phone near bed didn't work, and I advised them first day. Was never fixed entire four days. Noticed that lobby area near bar and the hallways were not cleaned often. Normally, could care less, but it was very unpleasant to see the same used martini and wine glasses in the lobby and the food trays sitting outside people's doors for days on end. And the hotel could use a better vacuum. Now with all of these minor nits, I did politely raise concerns with front desk etc. Each was met with a lovely smile, a knowing head-shake, and some charming lne about "whatever we Whenever, what is your wish" or something. Sadly, nothing was done. At check out, I again expressed my concerns and I think they really do care---but I would suspect nothing was done. They still had old wine glasses piled up near the bar from the night before. I will not be staying there again, and will return to my normal LA hotels of the Four Seasons and the Beverly Hilton. Even the century Plaza was better.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice - Loved the Pool and Extra Touches”
Reviews.Author: babygame
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights while moving my daughter back to UCLA. Have stayed at other places in Westwood and this will now be my number one choice - worth the extra money. We had a spectacular King suite overlooking the pool. We loved the pool, and the little extras in the pool bathrooms (like sunscreen packets). Also loved the elevator camera (when alone in the elevator), nice treats/melon juices offered at the reception desk, fast valet service, and free water bottles from valet service. Very comfy bed & wonderful showerhead (albeit not enough counters for our stuff in the bathroom). Only glitch we had was our bags taking so long to show up in the room & when they did, they were the wrong ones. Next time I will carry up! Also, they had no foam/ergonomic pillows. $35 valet fee. Will stay again! Very relaxing place.

Reviews.Title: “A Refined W? How Refreshing.”
Reviews.Author: TheHead33
Reviews.Content: I have a "love/hate" relationship with W Hotels. I have stayed in at least 10 of them around the US and they are either absurdly cheesy and rank pretentious (Atlanta Mid-town) or Fun Funky and Friendly (New Orleans French Quarter). I have discovered another kind of W in Los Angeles, one of refinement and cool class - without a shred of cheese, W Westwood. It is still dark with groovy lighting and chill sounds, but the welcome is more understated. The staff is inviting and unpretentious, treating you like a guest and not an annoyance (unlike the W Buckhead). The rooms are super large and beds are amazingly comfy. The typical W minibar I well stocked and tasty. I love to be surprised by a new hotel, as most of the time I am disappointed, and the W Westwood exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely suprise”
Reviews.Author: AM1379
Reviews.Content: Due to protesting at another hotel in West Hollywood, the hotel moved us to the W in Westwood and what a welcomed change that was! The staff here are truly amazing, we were made to feel like friends of the hotel not just guests. They went over and beyond what is required from a hotel. It is a relaxing and tranquil hotel is such a busy city. I hope you enjoy your stay as much as we did ours!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional staff, room & spa”
Reviews.Author: nomoremelanoma
Reviews.Content: I've enjoyed this hotel on many occasions and am frankly amazed at how consistently they exceed my expectations. Upon check-in, Cary recommended a different room for my daughter and I, and we loved it so much we booked another night! On a previous stay when my daughter was ill, a staff member offered to get her medicine for her in Westwood. The spa is delightful. They even offer a discount for UCLA students. I have stayed in many renowned hotels and have been disappointed with the service or attitude of the staff. Quite the contrary with the W. We will continue to be "frequent flyers" at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: canative101
Reviews.Content: This modern, sophisticated hotel has a very serene (and yet fun!) atmopshere. Not impressive from the exterior, but very impressive once you're inside. Excellent service and large suites. Within walking distance to UCLA.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible service, which made my business trip feel like it was for pleasure.”
Reviews.Author: joshua h
Reviews.Content: The hotel provided top-tier service which made my business trip go seamlessly. The concierge made great recommendations for dining with clients which was very appreciated. I look forward to staying at the W the next time I am in LA!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous contemporary oasis in LA”
Reviews.Author: vasalloe
Reviews.Content: this hotel is very serene and feels away from the madness of LA. I love the frank lloyd wright inspired architecture and overall design. the pool is a great place to get a tan and the vanilla creme french toast were amazing. one of the nicest hotels i've stayed in LA, so far.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: IrelandDeeDee
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Spectacular Room - it was the nicest room I have ever stayed in , everything about it was fab. Here is an email I sent the hotel when we got back! BTW we loved LA, friends had said it is a funny city but by leaving out downtown LA I think it meant we saw LA at its best (although Venice beach leaves a little to be desired - weird walking from fab Santa Monica to there! - also visited Universal Studios, Hollywood, Rodeo Drive, Bel Air, Beverly Hills , LAX! and Westwood, Santa Monica.Venice Beach.Love this city!!
