''I am sorry this email is a little late but I just wanted to make sure I emailed to say that we had the most amazing time in LA and the highlight of our trip was most definitly the W Hotel. We were stunned at how nice the room we had was. Everything about it was amazing and I have been raving to friends ever since. I would also like to compliment the staff at W Hotel Westwood. Every memeber of staff we encountered was polite and courteous and they always had a smile on their faces. We felt so comfortable there and had amzing meals in both restaurants as well as a very relaxing eveing in the bar. We stayed in six different hotels throughout our travels in Las Vegas, LA, San Francisco and Chicago and The W Hotel Westwood was by far the best in every way. I cannot remember the girls name who checked us in but she set the tone in a fantastic manner as she was so friendly when we arrived. We are already talking about returning to LA next summer and I will be definitly booking The W again. Well done to all your staff on fantastic customer service and making the customer feel like they are valued!! Thanks again for all your help!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic getaway. We can't wait to come back to the W Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: Tshultzy123
Reviews.Content: Great property. Close to everything. Shopping, beaches, dining. There's also so much to do at the hotel, you don't even have to leave. Customer service from the valet to the front desk was second to none.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Look!”
Reviews.Author: MerCooke
Reviews.Content: We stayed at a W elsewhere and like the brand. I signed up for the SPG Reward Card and used that to book our stay. This hotel is in a neighborhood. It's a little bit of a walk to some of the stores, but not too far. Our room was beautiful, big, great living room area, wonderful bathroom. There was no balcony, that would have been nice. The bedding and decor was amazing. Great mirrors, awesome lamps. We did have some trouble with our shower head (like it was hanging off the wall) and called several times to have it fixed, but the fix-it man was slow to show. We ate lunch at the restaurant outdoors. Dee-lish. Great, great service too. The pool looked inviting, but there were no open lounge chairs. There were several cabanas available so we asked how much they cost. $200! Ouch. I know that's posh, but really?!? Valet was so speedy. The doorman remembered our names and where we were from. Great attention to detail. All in all, we felt special at the W.

Reviews.Title: “W Westwood Forever !”
Reviews.Author: NalanJeffrey Y
Reviews.Content: An Incredible Location, Peaceful by day and enticing by night !! Whatever/Whenever holds up to their promise.... My wife and I were greeted with smiles and offered the names of all who offered assistance at any moment. Drinks at the sunny pool are second to none !

Reviews.Title: “Great room!”
Reviews.Author: Funkidivagirl
Reviews.Content: Great lobby, valet service, front desk service and bellmen. The room was fantastic, a suite with a living room, office area and separate bedroom. Nicely decorated in a comfortable, hip, modern style. Huge! Plenty of room for my family. 2 televisions. Lots of storage, although we didn't use it because we only stayed one night. Great bathroom, but I wish the wasted space was used for storage. There is an empty corner that would be great for shelves because there is nowhere to put your bathroom things except on top of the sink. The pool was a scene on Saturday late afternoon and impossible to find a seat. Quite the party place, the W pool. But there were plenty of kids there too (along with the bikini-clad party crowd). The pool is very small...fun for cooling off and splashing around, but you can't swim. The bar lounge is nice and the food is good. The MOST FUN is the elevator photo booth. Every time we got in there we vogued for the camera. We will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely & sassy - a total home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: jeremymmason
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. Whenever I have to travel to LA for meetings anywhere on Wilshire or near Century City, this is always my choice. It has all of the standard W amenities (Acura MDX available for nearby drop-offs, excellent room service food, killer bar area, Bliss spa, etc.). Their pool area gets massive sun exposure all day, and has lots of bar staff for quick service. (tip: if you're hungry at all, get the Greek meze platter to go with your white sangria - extremely tasty combo!) While the location is a little off the beaten path, there are several nice restaurants pretty close-by (including a nice sushi place, and an In-n'-Out for those of us who are addicted to those burgers). There is a Ralph's grocery store 2 blocks away so you can stock up on bottled water for the pool. And the local neighborhood is a blend of classic fraternity houses, expensive estates, and college housing - fun mix. Staff is great, friendly and helpful as normal for a W. All in all, a great property and always a pleasure to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, beautiful, perfect location, clean, fun. What else to ask for?”
Reviews.Author: lollapops
Reviews.Content: I live about an hour drive away from this hotel, but my family and I love it so much that we stay there almost every weekend! It is fun, exciting, beautiful, and everything and more in a hotel. I have chosen to have two teenager birthday parties there and a 40th birthday there, and it was definitely one of the best birthdays yet! Must go :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, though staff high nosed”
Reviews.Author: TravelGeeks2009
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in Westwood, a relatively quiet and residential area of LA. Close to Beverly Hills and West Hollywood, the hotel has a lovely garden and swimming pool area where lunch is served and the pool has nice cabana’s good drinks (although expensive) and food. I stayed in a suite on the 14the floor with a sitting area, a spare room with an expandable bed and a sleeping room, the hotel blackened the sleeping room upon request. I just stayed before that in Sofitel and except for the location, you can tell the quality difference with Sofitel (the latter being ahead of W in terms of luxury). What is annoying though in this hotel are the little sloppy things that make the stay unnecessary complicated. Flatly irritating is the tendency of some staff (especially the “Whenever, Whatever” guest services) to have a high nose attitude and worse, have a tendency to argue with the client even on subtle little things. I called the Guest services to tell them I had laundry at 8.55 am telling them I had a laundry bag but no laundry list. The guest services lady told me they would bring that up, when that took a while I called again then being told that there was a surcharge for a pickup after 9. I told her that I called before 9 am but that delivery could not be made because of the lack of laundry lists. Rather than solve this little issue easily she started arguing with me to a point that was flatly ridiculous and rude. I complained about this with the deputy manager “welcome staff” who made things worse by defending his staff and starting the rather silly discussion all over again. More of these small irritants caused by a high voice high nose attitude make this a hotel that is in need of a management turnaround.

Reviews.Title: “WATCH Your Bills or Credit Card Statement”
Reviews.Author: euro2006
Reviews.Content: Hmm, how should I begin my review? During my stay on the fourth of July weekend and days prior to seeing my monthly credit card statement, I was very happy with the W Los Angeles Westwood hotel. After that I'm still pissed. The Room - I stayed at the Spectacular Suite. The room looked somewhat similar to the pictures on the hotel website - spacious and nice, however, some signs of dated (particular the couch and its pillow cases) and I was a bit freak out by the countless mold-like spots on the circular mirror above the bed (still unable to figure out whether it was the original design or the real mold). Thin wall though, can easily hear the conversation from the hallway and the big bangs when other guests shutting their doors. No problem with plumbing as mentioned by other reviewers. The Staff and Service - Nice and very friendly staff. Anyway I still wonder why they kept telling me their names. I asked for a quiet room and they did assign me the nice one on the north wing. I didn't have a chance to try Acura Experience which is a drop-off service within 5 miles of the hotel (they don't do pick-up just simply drop-off). The service available M-F 7am-3pm, SAT-SUN 10am-6pm. The free Wi-Fi - I managed to access the hotel free Wi-Fi in my room (on the 14th floor) both on laptop and iPhone for the entire stay. I first logged on to the free Wi-Fi at the lobby from my phone - select the Living_Room Wi-Fi The Pool - The pool is relatively small and suitable for kids, don't trust what you see from the website. Private cabana looks great but they charge you for it. The Neighborhood - Westwood is such a nice neighborhood, the hotel located on the skirt of UCLA campus (one reviewer said the W used to be the UCLA dorm, I didn't have a chance to verify it). Many nice restaurants, cinemas and shops, you name it from Trader Joe's, RiteAid, CVS, Ralphs, Best Buy, AT&T, T-Mobile, Radio Shack, Urban Outfitters to Victoria's Secret. I'd recommend Le Pain Quotidien and Elysee for breakfast. Napavalley Grille has a beautiful outdoor seating area but mediocre food, not sure why it was packed. The sushi place right next to Le Pain Quotidien is so so. From the Airport - I took Prime Shuttle which costs $15. I guess Super Shuttle offers the same price. The GIMMICK and UGLY ENDING - You gotta watch your bills and your credit card statement. The hotel charged my credit card for minibar without my knowledge after I left. During the check out, they told me everything is all set, no extra charge since I prepaid for my room on the hotel website. Fortunately, after checked out, I was waiting for my friend to pick me up for about an hour at the lobby which they could have told me if something was missing but they didn't. When I saw the charge on my credit card statement, I rang them up and they told me it was a charge from the minibar and said can't do anything, I've to contact billing dept directly during the office hours (M-F/9-5). I wrote them and they gave me a refund about a week after. But still, I'm pissed. So without bad ending that they charged me for something that I didn't consume or service that I didn't use, I'd have rated my stay highly. Unfortunately, the rip-off scheme dragged down the whole customer satisfaction level. And I won't stay at this property again because of this incident. It's a big disappointment for the hotel in this class. I saw similar mention from other customers too so think twice before you book or hand them your credit cards. Good luck! PS When I booked this hotel, it ranked 26 now it's 36. Hopefully, my review would help drag them down a few spots.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't work for me”
Reviews.Author: historyknut
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a 2-room suite. The decor looks a little tired. The bedroom was very small for the furnishings. My hubby had to slow down to navigate the small area between the foot of the bed and the wall where a TV was mounted. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was nice. Good water pressure in shower. The lobby had some kind of asian/danish/modern inspiration thing going but it came off dark and confusing. You had to hunt for the front desk area. Previous stays at this hotel were in much better suites. The valet parking was great.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: Jaimecml
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Good things: location is convenient, rooms are amazing, service is excellent and we saw the cast of Glee there! Things that could improve: noise of air-conditioning is loud, walls are a bit thin & no free wireless.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a family with teenages”
Reviews.Author: 4onadventure
Reviews.Content: We are a family of 2 adults and a 17and 13 year old. We stayed in the spacious corner suite which consisted of a room with King bed, an office with a double sofa bed and a living space with 2 divan beds. We overlooked the pool and a suburban street. The staff were very helpful and we loved the decor. The location, walking distance to Westwood village, was handy for eating out locally . We felt extremely safe walking about. My husband was attending a conference at UCLA and this also was convenient for walking. As we had no car we found the taxis expensive

Reviews.Title: “Great front desk...Noisy plumbing.”
Reviews.Author: NRambo
Reviews.Content: For a one night stay it was decent. The ambassador was as nice as can be. He was down to earth, kind, great smile. The front desk agent, Gabriel, was super pleasant. Got us checked in quickly and had a wonderful attitude. Two major cons: 1) $35 valet. 2) Thin walls. I could here the person upstairs urinating, that's how thin. Then the pipes knocked around for 15-20 min.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a staff to match”
Reviews.Author: dlau888
Reviews.Content: I recently visited the W Hotel in Westwood and had a great experience. The rooms were very spacious, large bedroom, living room and quiet room for reading/office space. Each room comes with a DVD player for the kids and a docking station for your itune/music. Everyone was super friendly from the valet staff to the registration to house keeping. Everyone greeted you with a good morning/afternoon/evening when ever you walked by them. Two great bars to choose from, the Backyard which is by the pool is great to just lounge around and the one in the lobby is a hot spot in the evenings. By the time I checked out, the valet and registration staff all new my name. I'll definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Valet parking lost my car”
Reviews.Author: Maarten069
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 3 night in july. On the second day my rental car was lost by valet parkling. All day I worried sick whether this loss (Full size SUV) would be covered by the insurance of the rental company or the hotel. At the end of the day they found my car. The only compensating I got was not being charged for the valet parking! I filed a complaint at the front desk. They promised their manager would respond to me. I haven't heard until today. The hotel seems to care more about their nightclub than the hotelguest. There is no escaping the music, not even in your room and not even late at night.

Reviews.Title: “For celeb siting ... The place to be.”
Reviews.Author: gianninijrn
Reviews.Content: My initial impression was great... I was in the elevator with robin Williams! Great suites with large living room areas. Big enough for a small party with girl friends for a night on the town. Pool is great. Chefs walk into the pool clothed and hand out grapes, smoothies, and other refreshing treats. Loved the entire stay.

Reviews.Title: “For a huge hotel it had a great friendly feel”
Reviews.Author: JumbleLincolnshire
Reviews.Content: For such a large hotel in such a busy city it has a great freindly feel and made being away from home on business a pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: jooles22
Reviews.Content: The hotel is across the street from UCLA and within 10 minutes of both Santa Monica and Beverly Hills. It's in a wonderfully quiet area, which we like because we're kind of tired of staying in the more touristy areas. The hotel itself is very modern and stylish but has all the comforts you would want in a Starwood hotel and none of the pretension. The wonderful suite (our room) was very comfortable, and I love the Bliss bath products. We hung out by the pool everyday, which was so relaxing. All the staff were so friendly and helpful. For non-guests who complained that they couldn't get access to the hotel pool, I say "thank you" to the staff that enforce their rules. The pool area isn't huge and if I am paying to stay at this hotel, there better be a free chair for me at the pool. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Too Trendy, Good Location, Nice Suites”
Reviews.Author: Bungymax
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located a few blocks from Westwood Village and the UCLA campus, which were nice to walk around, but the hotel is just too trendy. Our group of friends in our 60s was the oldest around the pool area, which was nice, but there was always music blasting. The rooms are all suites, and although the living area was very roomy, the king bed was so close to the wall, it was difficult to get around between the bed and the flat screen TV hanging on the wall. The sitting area in the lobby was very dark, and the maid service was spotty. One day the room was made up early, and one day we had to call down 3 times to get someone to clean the room by 4:00!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed my time at W Westwood”
Reviews.Author: adnat70
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights as part of business trip. Great location for where I needed to be. As with most W hotels, this was a fun/hip hotel. Loved the entrance especially at night with the lit staircase. Room was spacious enough and nicely decorated. Liked the separate sleeping and living areas. Natural light was lacking, so i had to turn on the lights during the day. Maybe that's the mood they want to set as most of the hotel is dimly lit, especially the gym. Darkest gym I've ever been in. It was small but had enough free weights and cardio equip. Wi-fi is $15, but you can take your device to the lobby and it's free. The Backyard (pool and lounge area) was great. Great scenery and the happy hour prices can't be beat. Overall, happy with my stay and most likely would stay again if i needed a place around the Westwood area.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, hotel was a bit too trendy though”
Reviews.Author: am5
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights and it was pretty nice! We checked in really late on our first night there (like at 1AM). The lobby was a bit overwhelming at that hour. Music was blaring and the whole place felt like a dance club not a hotel lobby. It was a bit too much after traveling on a plane all day. I just wanted to get to my room, not deal with the party scene, scantily clad people, and all that noise. We were rewarded when we finally did get to our room. There was a bottle of champagne and a chocolate dessert set out for my birthday! It was a nice surprise treat for 1AM. The rooms themselves are quiet and spacious. There is a lot of hallway noise and banging around in the morning though from the cleaning staff. They were especially loud when they were right above our room. Our room was a junior suite and it had a separate living room with a couch and tv. I'm not sure if every room is like that but it was nice. I liked the toiletries in the bathroom. They were Bliss spa products and smelled lemony. This hotel does have some crazy charges though - wifi, valet parking, room service, etc. We asked for beach towels one day and they put a $50 charge on your card until you return them. We returned them and I asked to make sure they would remove the charge and the guy said he would right away. Well guess what, the charge was still there upon check-out! I asked them to remove it again and they finally did. Just make sure you double check your bill at check-out. We had a 50% off coupon for room service and our breakfast bill for 1 croissant, 2 muffins, and 2 glasses of tap water was still $14. The elevators are super annoying here. You have to insert your card in just the right way to get to your floor. If another group already entered the elevator and did their card then you are screwed. The elevator is already zooming past your floor before you get to insert your card and press your floor button. You will end up going way up to a high floor and then you'll have to ride the elevator back down again to your floor. I heard numerous people complaining about this. The hotel should just get rid of the need to swipe the cards first. I would stay at this hotel again if the price was right. The rooms are pretty luxurious and the hotel is in a nice location. It is easy to get to other areas in LA from this neighborhood as long as you have a car!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel - highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: nyt0urist
Reviews.Content: Was here with my wife and we really enjoyed our stay here. Service and food were as expected for a W hotel. After 3 days, the Valet car people knew us by first name. Little touches like that make all the difference. It was a great location because we were attending a wedding and visiting friends in the area and touring around. For some people really wanting to check out the Hollywood party scene, maybe the W hotel in Hollywood would be better. Otherwise, we loved it here. PROS: - great pool - good service - hotel bar had great drinks CONS: - not right in Hollywood - parking is expensive (but that's LA, right?)

Reviews.Title: “overpriced, dated, lobby feels like a pick up joint”
Reviews.Author: gmansc
Reviews.Content: This is definitely not a place for middle class families. I got a good deal on a suite, apparently due to low booking. However, the daily cost jumped seriously when mandatory parking was added on. No self parking whatsoever -- all valet. And the staff are kind of sickly sweet edging for a tip every time you turn around. After a while I gave up and stopped tipping altogether. Breakfast was ungodly expensive. For a family of four light eaters (oatmeal, waffles, etc.) we couldn't get out of there for less than $90. They charge for internet and make it clear that the cost is "per device." The lobby feels like a pick up joint out of Boogy Nights. Our room was nice and spacious. However, once out of the room, we were very uncomfortable with blue lights, needy staff and Paris Hilton wanna bees everywhere. The W is convenient for families visiting UCLA. But if you book a room for ~ $300 per night, be prepared to spend nearly $500 with one meal. Next time we'll stay on Wilshire and drive to campus. One last note, if you do stay there, look at your bill carefully when checking out. A $100 room service charge was incorrectly added to our bill. Took three phone calls and two days to straighten it out. (Despite all the "luxury," their accounting staff aren't available on weekends.) To their credit, though, they did remove the charge and apologized.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the W”
Reviews.Author: Seala
Reviews.Content: Just recently returned from a great stay at the Westwood W and would definitely recommend it. The lobby had a great atmosphere, big modern and spacious and the outdoor pool and lounge area were also great. A nice place to relax and unwind after a day running around LA. The location in westwood is also great. Very convenient to all of LA. The room was also well decorated and spacious and quite comfortable. Most of the rooms are suites and it is quite ideal for multiple guests. The only downside was that there are no fans in the bathroom and so it can get a bit steamy. I was equally impressed with the hotel staff. They were extremely accomodating to our requests and even upgraded our room. If you are looking for an upscale convenient and modern place to stay in LA I would definitely recommend the W. I found that it met my expectations and since I travel a lot I am fairly particular about where I stay. Since Internet pricing varies, I would say to search around for a good deal. Though the parking was pricey at $35, this is LA afterall.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time and would definitely stay here again!!!”
Reviews.Author: ktmcginn05
Reviews.Content: My cousin and I stayed here in July 2011 on my first trip to LA. The hotel is not right in the center of activity, but I liked that! It was pretty quiet, very relaxing, and just a short drive away from Hollywood, Robertson, etc. When we arrived, there was a fruit and cheese tray and Fiji bottled water waiting for us, along with a hand written note telling us to enjoy our stay... A nice little extra touch! We stayed in a decent-sized suite with plenty of seating space to relax, drink wine, and watch TV. The room was very clean, and we we received excellent customer service throughout our stay. The few drawbacks about the room were that shower didn't drain very well or have ventilation in the form of a fan, etc. (wouldn't bother normal people, but I am a bit chlostrophobic!), the hair dryer was AWFUL, and the room never seemed to get cold enough. But as I said before, the customer service is beyond reproach... I'm sure if we had mentioned any of this to the staff, they would have made every effort to remedy these situations, but we never took the time to ask. There is also no overhead lighting, but that only bothered me when I was trying to get ready/put on my makeup, etc. The Bliss products that they leave in the bathroom each day are actually ones that you will want to use instead of the products that you brought with you! The parking is $35 a night, and it is worth it the 1st night when you are onloading all your bags and getting familiar with the area. If you don't feel like paying that much for parking every day (we didn't!), there is very inexpensive parking just around the corner, across the street from UCLA & down the street from Best Buy. We found a space every time! All in all, it was a beautiful hotel with excellent customer service and I would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED LOVED IT!! A definite must and superb service! We'll be back!!”
Reviews.Author: CarolinaGirlinParis
Reviews.Content: I am a definite W fan, so I love to stay where there is a W...I chose this one for a trip to LA with my cousin (her first trip to LA) over July 4th weekend. I was a little worried based off of some of the reviews, but I always read through and am willing to sometimes take a chance to see if my experience is the same as others....and I must say I 100% disagree with all of the negative reviews! We had a PHENOMENAL time!!! I was so bad at getting people's names this trip (I usually get them and remember...but basically from June 30 at 8pm until July 3 at 9am anyone who was working the desk, lobby, breakfast area or valet/front door is included in this comment), but all of these people were absolutely cheerful, helpful and very nice!! They even asked us if we got to our room and decided we wanted another one, to let her know and she would be happy to change it for us. The day we checked out, the nice young man at the front desk was very helpful in correcting our bill and asked to make sure there wasn't anything else he could do for us. I think we didn't encounter a single person who wasn't attentive and super helpful! We had so much fun with the camera booth in the elevator always dancing and making funny faces...you just have to remember that you might be striking some funny dance pose right as the doors open!!! We laughed every time! The room was GREAT!! We had a great living room with a huge L-shaped couch, you usual cool W decor and then a great sleeping area that had everything that we needed. Even loved the Ipod/Iphone hookup so we could jam to our own tunes while getting ready to go out! Yes, as in previous reviews, the bathrooms may be small...but really...you are in LA...how much time are you going to spend in the bathroom??!?! It really goes with the modern decor and even with 2 girls in one room, we didn't have a problem sharing the bathroom. We also enjoyed the hotel bar one night after a dinner on the town. The decor in the W bars are just exceptional and fun! I love love the live DJ!!! I'd agree though, it's not a place to be bringing your little kids down, but for the rest of us, it was such a nice relaxing, fun environment. We did park at the hotel the first nigh which was $35/night...but to be honest, I travel a lot for work and in every major CITY (not the burbs) that is not unheard of and is fairly common rate...I paid the same in Atlanta. BUT one tip I might add for those staying is that we found parking literally right around the corner every single other day/night!! Yes, they have parking meters, but we put in a couple of dollars and it was good for a few hours...more than enough time for us to get ready or between our outings and then after 8pm it was free until 8am (M-S) or 11am(Sun). There was an open parking spot every time, so I'd highly recommend if you aren't just hanging out at the hotel all day. But when we did use the valet, they were superb!!! They offered us bottled water for our trip out for the day and if we needed anything else. The location is great also! It's not right in the middle of BH, but literally right down the road from the Bev Hilton and all the Rodeo Drive/Robertston Blvd fun!! I loved the location (PS: Try Paris Bakery around the corner). Hmmm, trying to think of the cons....still thinking....oh, right, we thought the hairdryer was too small...you know how girls need a big hairdryer! And if THAT is the only thing I can come up with, then I'd say this is a definite A+ for the W LA!!! It was my cousin's first trip to LA and she said she loved the hotel and the great service they gave us! We'd definitely come back and recommend to anyone!!! Please pass on our thanks to all of your staff and hope that we see y'all again soon!!! Thanks W LA for a great trip (we also loved the nice plate of fruit you had for us when we arrived in our room!).

Reviews.Title: “Another Fantastic Stay!!”
Reviews.Author: loholly
Reviews.Content: We just returned from another great weekend in LA and our 3rd stay the W in Westwood. This time we brought my husbands parents along and they agreed. Great hotel, great service. Again-we had a fantastic stay at the W hotel. The staff are all so very nice and helpful. Our rooms were large and comfortable. We felt very welcome. This hotel has excellent customer service from every member of the staff. We will return and bring more people with us. The pool is also fantastic!!

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended - save time, money, and aggravation by choosing another hotel”
Reviews.Author: TouristSanDiego
Reviews.Content: This hotel did not live up to my expectations. I should have read the reviews prior to our visit. The W Hotel in Westwood tries too hard to be hip. In doing so, they really miss the mark. The exterior of the hotel is aged and unattractive, but the club atmosphere starts with the blue lighted stairs and continues to the lounge like lobby with loud music. If traveling with children, avoid the pool which is small, crowded and filled with drunk young adults making out on chaise lounge chairs. Even the cabana interiors have silhouettes of people dancing with hands in the air. We drove to LA and called the hotel 5 minutes out to see if our rooms were ready, the front desk stated that they could not tell me until I was at the hotel. I told them the cross streets and explained that we would be there in a few minutes if the room was ready, but would rather come later if it was not ready. They again stated that I had to be there in person at the front desk before they could provide any information. Upon arrival, I was told that our rooms were not ready. I mentioned that they needed to be connecting (as we told the reservation specialist and was noted in our confirmation). He told me that the hotel had no connecting rooms and that ours were on separate floors. 45 minutes later, he found 2 rooms on a low floor that were next to each other. He gave me the key to one. It was a queen (we reserved and paid for a king) and was cramped with a garden view (which actually meant we looked out onto the roof). I told the front desk that the selection was not acceptable and told him we would sight see and return later that evening. At 7PM, we returned and were given keys to our new rooms. They were on the same floor and down the hall from each other. Not really what we wanted since the 2nd room was for our children. Every time we needed to interact, we had to dress and head down the hall. We ended up with a queen (downgraded from what we paid for). They layout of the rooms is odd at best. Small bathrooms with shower/ tub combo, plastic trash cans, 1 robe, no slippers, and limited bath amenities - basically what you'd expect at a Holiday Inn. The bathroom did not connect to the bed room. The water heater made the temp too hot or warm with alternating cold. The desk chairs are hard plastic and too low to be useful. Poor lighting. The beds are firm - almost futon like. There is only 1 extra pillow to provide a total of three and no extra blanket. The windows do not provide adequate sound proofing from the party at the pool and the shutters without blackout curtains ensure that you will be up with the sun. There is no newspaper delivery nor turndown service. We called for slippers and waited 45 min the 1st night before canceling the order and re-ordering the following day. The carpet in the hallway was never vacuumed during our 3 day stay and there was hair in our bathroom and in bedroom drawers. Parking was $35 per day. Wi-fi is $14.99 per 24 hours (noon to noon). We were there for a birthday (as noted on the reservation), but no acknowledgement was made by management. Upon receipt of our bill, we noted that we were charged parking for 2 vehicles and also a mini bar item that we did not consume. The best things about the hotel are the: Valet attendants - polite and prompt Location- adjacent to UCLA campus Fun restaurants and snacks - Ditty Reese, Barney's Beanery, Stans Donuts You can experience the fun of Westwood at other hotels. Stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: TravelingNurse2027
Reviews.Content: My husband booked this hotel from Hotwire and we were very happy . The area of town was very pretty ( close to UCLA) and the hotel was very nice. The staff was very attentive . We upgraded to a better room for a minimal fee and what a nice room it was with a comfortable sitting area where we sat on the sofa and watched tv and we rarely do that in any hotel. The pool area was very nice with good drinks and food. I would definitely stay here again .

Reviews.Title: “Right next door to UCLA”
Reviews.Author: travelerit
Reviews.Content: The location for the W in Westwood is excellent. The outside of the hotel is very worn looking, but inside the furnishings are nice. I was lucky to get an upgrade to the one bedroom suite and it was fantastic. Service at the hotel overall is good. There are many shops and restaurants nearby and the UCLA campus is a stone's throw. Please enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Tres cool, tres great location!”
Reviews.Author: RuHuNJ
Reviews.Content: This very hip hotel is a in great location for visitors to LA. Being in Westwood is a real plus, and then you have access to all parts of town. This is a service-oriented hotel that aims to please; everyone seems genuinely appreciative when you lay on a tip. The restaurant is great for meetings and the pool is a beautiful place to relax and see what (who) you can see. The extras that they charge for (e.g., computer printer even for boarding passes) is annoying, but perhaps that is life in the big city. This place is full of surprises! And great amenities!

Reviews.Title: “Atrocious Stay”
Reviews.Author: cdmlaura
Reviews.Content: I was appalled by the condition of the hotel and level of service, given the price. The following incidents occurred: 1. Upon arrival late Thursday night, my sister and I were given a suite with a Queen at a rate of $389. I recalled that we had a King, and the next morning on my way out the door, I asked about it. The woman at the front desk would not give me the King without my confirmation or unless I would pay an extra $30 or $40 a night. I didn’t have my reservation confirmation with me, but I found it later that day, and our reservation confirmation stated we had a suite with a King for $369. This was remedied Friday afternoon upon another visit to the front desk. We were ultimately charged $389 for the room, but on Sunday when I checked out, I was able to get the price adjusted to the quoted rate. 2. When I woke up in our suite with a Queen on Friday morning. I went to the bathroom to shower and inside the tub there was a brown/black splatter liquid everywhere. It looked like mud or sewage or someone had been violently ill all over the tub. I immediately called the concierge to have it fixed. I waited a half hour and no one came. I had an appointment I had to make, so I called back. Someone finally came within the hour. He cleaned up the mess but said that he’d need to come back to clear out the drain. I had to shower and get ready to leave, so I showered in water that literally came up to my knees. Disgusting. 3. We switched rooms Friday afternoon. Again, the shower in our second room filled up to mid calf every time we showered. This is absolutely filthy. 4. Our second room, like the first, mysteriously only had one robe. I requested one on Friday afternoon. None arrived. I requested one late Friday evening. None arrived. I called for a third time Saturday afternoon for a robe, and finally one arrived. 5. Upon arrival in the second room, I went to grab a glass. The glass was covered in “protective/sanitary” plastic, but it also was covered in a yellow fugusy film around the rim. I called for new glasses. None arrived. I called for new glasses with the robe late Friday evening, and they finally arrived. In addition, it was quite shocking that housekeeping did not remove this filthy glass from the room when they cleaned it on Saturday. While all of these things were unacceptable for a hotel with such a high rate, what was so baffling to me was the fact that no one asked me how my stay was (even on check out when I was getting our bill adjusted!!!), tried to remedy any of these situations, or seem to really care about our stay. I have stayed at hotels with wide ranging price points, and this was by far the worst service I have ever received.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay in LA”
Reviews.Author: OrlandoBubbie
Reviews.Content: Even though this W hotel is not the newest in the SPG portfolio it is very well maintained on a beautiful street in West LA. It is walking distance to many restaurants, whole foods, trader joes and coffee shops. I was in the property for 9 days on business and honestly did not want to leave. The staff were prompt and courteous, the room was large with plenty of room to stretch out and the hotel is not over crowded with partying LA people. It actually felt very relaxing. I will definitely stay again. As a side note, I used some SPG points to stay one night at the SLS while I was in LA and I feel the staff at the W are far superior when it comes to treating guests with excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Hideaway”
Reviews.Author: thepotatoCAT
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel to stay in. It is very modern, chic, clean, and spacious. The elevators have a camera that you can take photobooth style pictures as you ride your way up to your room. My family and I stayed in a Fabulous Suite and it had a very comfy pull out couch and a large living room area separate from the master bed. The best part was that the room had a door so everyone can have their privacy and you can block out dad's snoring! They have yummy restaurant options in the hotel but eating out is great too because of its location. The hotel itself is tucked away in a quiet part of LA really close to UCLA campus but it's also super close to places like Rodeo drive and other must-see/eat places of LA. All in all it's very nice hotel in a great location and compared to the four seasons it has even better value!

Reviews.Title: “The W hotel popped!”
Reviews.Author: Starwood2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westwood W hotel for a University Graduation celebration. Our suite was extremely spacious and clean. The pool was busy in the afternoon, but the following morning it was a lazy, sunny Sunday and we enjoyed brunch by the pool. Service opened at 10:00. There was complimentary coffee/tea in the cafe area. Hotel Valet parking was expensive.

Reviews.Title: “The W Westwood is now my home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: kjohn5815
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at The W Hotel Westwood. This was her first time out to LA. I needed everything to be perfect because we're planning to relocate to LA by years end. Although it was a business trip for me, I wanted her to be entertained and enjoy herself. I had contacted The W to inquired about the negative reviews I was reading online. They assured me my trip would be Fabulous. I went ahead and booked the room. Once you open the doors of The W you enter what they call "the living room". It's a spacious open floor plan with seating perfectly suited for mingling. The young lady at the front desk checked us in quickly and pointed out some of the amenities of The W. Once giving your keycard, you enter the elevator that has a tiny camera that shows still frame images of you with sayings like "show us your moves." My wife and I danced in the elevator till we reached our floor. Our Spectacular room was nice. Although it was small, It was nicely decorated and not too cluttered or overdone. When you walk in the room had a glass reading table with two chairs. Take a couple steps and there was a 42" plasma tv on a swivel above a wrap around couch. The bed was made up with extra thick blankets and padding. And made me sleepy looking at it. The bathroom was nice and clean. After we checked in to our Spectacular Suite, I had to go to the music studio to do some recording. My wife found herself by the pool a few minutes later and had fun relaxing poolside. She also enjoyed the spa. The location was great. I was able to get to Rodeo Dr, Hollywood, Venice Beach and other sight seeing locations easily. We danced the night away at the club. I wish our stay was a little longer. Overall my wife left talking great things about LA. So you guys help me win her over The pros- room was very nice. The mini-bar was fully stocked. The bed was extra comfy. The room service was great. The cons- we didn't have a tub, just a shower. The windows didn't have black out drapes so I ended up getting up earlier then I would have like to. And there was only one person at the front desk when I needed to ask a mid stay question. Ohh and parking is $35 per 24 hr period. Thank you Alyssa for all your help. You and your staff pay close attention to detail and help deliver a memorable trip. Can't wait to come back

Reviews.Title: “Good Alternative to Hyatt Century City”
Reviews.Author: kjnole66
Reviews.Content: We travel to LA about 6 weekends a year and usually stay at the Hyatt Century City. We had been wanting to check out the W sowWe stayed here Saturday night to take in a baseball game, We had a corner suite. Here are some pros and cons: Pros: Room was large, room service is all night; mini bar nicely stocked, comfy bed, quiet room. Cons: There was only 1 person checking people in so there was quite a wait-it wasn't terribly long, maybe 15 minutes but still longer than we have experienced elsewhere. The shower/tub combination was quite small-not large enough for two people. The lighting in the bathroom was very poor-no way you have enough light to shave and do makeup. No black out drapes -just plantation type shutters. They look nice but do not keep it dark in the morning. Overall, it was okay...we will probably look elsewhere the next time we are in town. But if you don;t mind the above cons, this is a nice hotel all around.

Reviews.Title: “One of Our Favorite Hotels now has Chef Dakota Weiss”
Reviews.Author: Shiba-Inu-Parents
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at the W in Westwood many times, it’s truly a home away from home for us. We really appreciate the convenience and high standards of this hotel property. The staff throughout the hotel really seems to enjoy what it’s doing. They truly understand the hospitality business. The property is spotless, and the rooms are very clean and modern. We regularly dine at the hotel and major changes have recently occurred. Although we had always been happy with the food at Nine Thirty (which is the street address of the hotel) and the Backyard, we were anticipating the arrival of the new chef, Dakota Weiss, at the beginning of the year. We had heard from Ren Hirose, the GM, and restaurant managers Chris Cazares and Stephanie Sanders that she had survived an amazing round of tastings, up against some 20-plus other chefs. No doubt the competition was fierce – sounds like it could have been a ubiquitous reality show. We gave her about three weeks to settle in before heading over for our first visit, and the verdict is in. Naturally, in such a short time she hadn’t completely redone the menus, but her touches were already apparent. For example, the previous chef had an appetizer (or “side,” as it’s referred to there) of Brussels sprouts. Many people don’t particularly care for Brussels sprouts, but these were good. Very good. They’re something we never would have previously thought to order off a menu. Dakota Weiss changed the seasonings and made the preparation healthier (grilled rather than fried), and we didn’t miss the old version at all. Being independently creative, Dakota moved on from Brussels sprouts to create an appetizer of baby artichokes in smoked garlic aioli and chopped basil that is also healthy, flavorful and out of this world. Her new creations are full of twists. A very grown up macaroni and cheese uses very small, round pasta (their true name escapes us), with bacon, apple bits and garlic bread crumbs. This is definitely not the fake orange powdered boxed stuff we all made growing up, nor even an adult version of a traditional mac and cheese. Other sides were delightfully different – charred broccoli with lemon, red chili oil and parmesan. Honestly, if all food were prepared and served this way, multitudes of children wouldn’t have grown up afraid to try anything green, healthy and supposedly boring. We’re working our way through the menu – we often order several sides (and “smalls” which are truly a few bites to share), some of which show up time and time again – and entrees (a “large”). There’s something for every palate – seafood, fish, chicken, steak. A favorite is the beef bourguignon – anyone who has watched “Julie and Julia” might try it for that reason alone, but it is quite satisfying. And the desserts are lots of fun and creative – who would think of a chocolate creation, including chocolate puffed rice – in a tall parfait glass? Everything is beautifully plated. But the most fun is Dakota herself. We asked to meet her after our first meal and have spoken with her several times since, and all we can say is, what fun. She definitely looks the part of a creative person. If you saw her on the street, you might think she was an actress. Always bubbly and charming, her tone indicates her love for what she’s doing, which is good given the long hours and weighty expectations. Although many very creative people are thought of as not being terribly business-minded or organized (yes, it’s a stereotype, but there is a reason they exist!), her comments indicate her seriousness about how she runs her kitchen. There, she’s definitely the captain of the ship and she expects it to be run with precision and excellence -- but for the staff to enjoy it as well. We’re looking forward to more dining adventures as Dakota sets new culinary trends.

Reviews.Title: “Like coming home”
Reviews.Author: avizaid
Reviews.Content: Right in the center of all action.The mega suite is very specious,interesting food at the Resturant next to the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Allergy to cigarette smoke”
Reviews.Author: nyctravel8
Reviews.Content: I have been looking forward to my stay at the W hotel since Feb. when I booked my "fabulous suite". I arrived at the hotel today only to find that the hotel staff ran out of non-smoking rooms and stuck us in a smoking suite. Given that I have had bronchial infections in the past, I was insistent that they accommodate us to what was available until a non-smoking suite opened up. The only option we were offered was to downgrade our room so that the 3 of us would share 1 bed, OR upgrade it even further for a significant fee. It felt like they were looking to crank out couple of more bucks from us. Ultimately we were given no choice but to stay in our room and open all the windows to air out the second hand smoke and this has only soured the experience even further. I understand circumstances occur but in the case where the hotel gave away our room, they should have made reparations for mishandling our reservations. Extremely disappointed, travelers beware! Ourcheck-in staff did not seem to care and made no effort to help us find another room that is non-smoking.

Reviews.Title: “They don't get the basics right”
Reviews.Author: GwyneddBluebell
Reviews.Content: Our suite was cold, heating not working, had to use fan heaters. It was a 3 room suite, but only one fan heater could be used at a time, otherwise the fuses would trip and all the lights would go out. So we had to keep swapping out the heaters. Bedroom windows only had wooden shutters which didn't close properly. Maintenance men had to rig up a temporary blackout with fabric and bulldog clips. Sinks didn't drain efficiently, and the walls were really thin. All the staff you encounter tell you their names, which I found unsettling as I felt I should remember them next time we met. The pool area was good, except it was surrounded by speakers pumping out loud music. This ruined any chance of relaxation, either to read a book, or even listen to your own choice of music on headphones. It drowned out everything. Also, the hot water was turned off for maintenance twice for 6 hours. The food in the restaurant was OK, but there are many restaurants in Westwood, a few blocks away. Room service got orders wrong. Overall, I suggest they forget about the "whatever, whenever " concept and get the basics right. Blackout drapes, good plumbing and heating, and giving guests the choice of peace and quiet by the pool would be a start. Oh, and parking costs $35 a day.

Reviews.Title: “In love with Westwood”
Reviews.Author: ThamyresVM
Reviews.Content: Westwood is an amazing place to stay while in Los Angeles. A very charming and quiet neighborhood full of cafes, restaurants (vegetarian options too), shops and cinemas; frequented by local students. W Westwood is a good choice in the area. The rooms are clean, spacious and well furnished. The restaurant is decent so as the pool area. No free parking

Reviews.Title: “A hidden jewel in the L.A. area.”
Reviews.Author: EdCassidy
Reviews.Content: A wonderful hotel with glorious rooms (it doesn't get better than suite 803) in one of the best locations in the metro L.A. area. The staff is caring and attentive -- and you'll be spoiled by the best valet staff you'll ever come across."

Reviews.Title: “Upgrade Made this one of my Top Starwood Stays”
Reviews.Author: laurengucsb
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel as it was close to my LA office and I'm a Starwood Platinum member. It was the weekend of the Oscars so the hotel was sold out and when I arrived at approximately 11pm, they told me that had upgraded me once, but had to upgrade me again since they were completely sold out. Worked for me, I got to stay in an amazing Mega suite. A bit unnecessary for my 8 hours in the hotel (only spent sleeping), but the 8-room suite was incredible. Very nicely done and very spacious, there was a huge entryway with wet bar area, which lead to a bathroom on the right and one bedroom, a table area straight ahead and a large couch area with TV, etc. Off of that, there was a room with a couch and a desk, another bedroom and another bathroom with a huge soaking tub. I really can't say I experienced much of the hotel since I was there only to sleep, but the little service I had was pretty good. The hotel is missing some of the touches I've experienced at other Ws (personal notes or message on the phone welcoming me) and even when I was being checked in, the man seemed a bit like he was doing me a favor giving me the upgrade. Trust me, I appreciate it, but it's also their choice -- it's a much better experience when they say with excitement, we have a great room for you! without making you feel like you owe them something more. I think the location is great, you can walk to Westwood shops and restaurants so in the morning it was easy to pick something up at the Coffee Bean. I was even able to find street parking overnight. The hotel was chaotic on a Thu night, very trendy, but I didn't have any issue with the noise once I was in my room. I agree with the one comment about the lighting though -- there are lights everywhere but not a lot of light switches so you're attempting to find the switch on each light in the dark which is a bit of a pain. I will consider this hotel again if I get a deal and it actually looks like I need to go back to my LA office next month, so I will check at this hotel first.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not like other W Hotels.”
Reviews.Author: claybrizendine
Reviews.Content: I came to LA on business wanting to stay with Starwood, my preferred hotel chain, but also didn't want to spend a ton of time driving. The W Westwood was a good compromise on paper, but wasn't what I had expected. One of my favorite hotels is the W San Francisco, and when I saw that the W Westwood was all suites, I was stoked. I made the reservation and hoped for the best. Here's what I found: 1) The room, a Spectacular Suite, was broken up into 3 very small rooms - living room, bedroom, and bathroom. The feeling was almost claustrophobic. 2) Parking is only valet for > $30/night. Many of the side-streets you can't part on because they are either residential or part of UCLA. 3) My room had non-working light switches. 4) The tub didn't drain. 5) I couldn't wash my hands without my hands hitting the faucet and the sink basin at the same time. 6) There were not many restaurants to choose from around the area. I brought all of this to the attention of the front desk attendant at the time, Heather, and she was more than helpful and was very willing to fix any of the issues that I had by moving me to a new room. However, the issues were a little too many and I cut my stay short at the W and moved to a new hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not your typical W hotel....”
Reviews.Author: ritzB8
Reviews.Content: My room was at the end of the hall although I had requested a room close to the elevator. I didn't sleep well as the exit door was next door and all night someone was coming in and out that door and closing with a bang. I groggily woke up around 8 am, but to even worse a noise. There were housekeeping people just talking loudly with mechanics/technicians, other maids, and beverage person (4 people). The hallway echoed so didn't make the situation better at all. When I came out of my room, they all stopped talking and managed to say good morning. I relaly wanted to say "Shut up, I heard you all morning!!" What a disaster stay! The parking was $35, not $32 as it says on the web site. There was also a charge for the internet. Much too much for what it's worth! This 'W' is nothing like any of the other 'W's" I've stayed at. Disappointing and I clearly do not refer this to any 'W' follower. It was not worth the $300+ I paid. T

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel I ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: Jolene88
Reviews.Content: What an experience! The staff is superfriendly and very helpfull. The rooms are exquisite, and the beds!!! The beds are so extremely comfortable I wished I could take them home in my suitcase. The swimming pool is a superrelaxed place, with nice loungechairs, cabana's and a bar. Dont know what else to write, litterally everything was superb!

Reviews.Title: “Ouch”
Reviews.Author: volta
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location if you need to visit the UCLA area because you are closer to campus than some of the parking lots. However, when making reservations we were notified that the water would be turned off from 10am the following day. I had an 8am appointment so I would be OK, but really? The hotel seems to have major plumbing issues becaue the drains were clogged the last time I was there and the sink was still pooling water. They should have at least compensated the guests with something for having to put up with their plumbing problem. The suite we were in had a spacious redecorated living area. However, the bedroom was jammed with furniture, including a wooden bench at the foot of the bed I ran into with my shin in the middle of the night when I had to use the restroom. I still have a major bump and bruise on my shin over two weeks later. I called last week to let the manager know of my accident, just so they may want to rethink furniture placement, but they wouldn't even but me through to him/her. Instead they routed me to security who seemed this was a nuisance call. I am still waiting to hear from the manager. It seems as though the customer service, except for the concierge, is lacking at the W.

Reviews.Title: “Great Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: copy_that
Reviews.Content: Many commercial companies from out of town use the W Hotel Westood as a base of operations when they're shooting in LA. It's pricey, but the customer service and the locale make it worth hit. You're close to the 405, you have great restaurants in the surrounding area, and the hotel itself impresses clients. Conference rooms are equipped with any technology you might need. The catering is spot on and very accommodating... they arranged food for a breakfast meeting very last minute on more than one occasion. W Hotel is used to people using a room as an office and will arrange for extra chairs and more. Room service is quick and most items are amazing, esp their burgers. Rooms for guests are clean and well laid out. Trendy decor as par the course for a W Hotel, and extra nice bathrooms. No complaints except my clients never like the outdoor restaurant. It looks impressive but I've heard complaints about cold food and inattentive bar tenders. I direct them to the Palomino down the street.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about Service and it Starts from the Top...”
Reviews.Author: yobigjoe
Reviews.Content: Just returned back to the Bay Area after 3 nights at the W Westwood. What a great trip! We were celebrating two birthdays (one late Dec / the other early Jan) with a long 3-night weekend and after reading reviews and looking at many of the Starwood properties I know I picked the right place. First, I was booked into the new W Hollywood and after reading horrible reviews of noise and partying all night I decided that was not the scene we were looking for. Then, booked the Sheraton Delfina Santa Monica (we've been there before, nice but nothing overly special) and because I wanted to be closer to Beverly Hills area made a reservation for the SLS. Then decided that would be overkill (and dark) so finally ended up at the W Westwood. The right choice. What was best about it? The Service. I had let the hotel know that we were celebrating a birthday (via e-mail) and as a SPG Gold member anything they could do upgrade wise would be appreciated. Upon check-in I was offered a corner Spectacular Suite on a high floor (which was great since there were just the two of us, about 600sf). As I used Starpoints, I could have paid to upgrade to one of the bigger suites ($60-$200 a night) but this one meet our needs just fine. The bed was the highlight--really comfy. Check-in was a breeze, the suite was ready (benefit of checking in on a Thursday). Was even asked if I needed a 4 pm checkout on Sunday (nice touch!). Was taken up to the room and not long after we arrived a up came a bottle of champagne and a little chocolate cake with a card from Ren the GM. How cool is that? That is one of the reasons I stay loyal to Starwood-- most of them know how to take care of their frequent guests. As I majored in hospitality and worked in several hotels, I know how difficult it is to try and please everyone and we loyal guests can be demanding. :) Whenever I called for wine glasses, extra towels or to get the room serviced quickly someone was there in 5 minutes. Amazing. Folks on the phone were friendly and professional and were able to answer my questions. A note about the area--it seemed like a strange for a W Hotel to be. I usually think of them as beach front or in the heart of the city. I'm assuming this hotel was something else and was converted into a W. They did a good job. Few things to note: The AT&T iPhone Service was great from the suite. Full 3G - good signal strength. Was a nice surprise. I wish the bathroom in our suite was bigger and more modern. It was really small and the toilet faced the sink. Very strange set-up. When checking in I found out that many of the suites don't have bath tubs (just showers) and we wanted a tub so maybe that's the reason. Don't know how big the shower only ones are. Bring a portable speaker system for your iPod/iPhone if you want to listen to music in your suite. I was surprised that it was missing since it seems like that is common in the W's I've stayed in. With the strange residential like location, you aren't going to get amazing views from your suite like you would if you were closer to the beach or the hills. And, because the hotel was most likely a refurb the windows are small and have shutters. All furniture is modern, TV's are new and the bed comfy. There is only one robe in the suite which is strange. You have to call for another one. Maybe they get more solo business travelers there? The facility itself is the perfect size. Great lobby lounging (a W trademark) and bar area out by the pool with complimentary coffee in the cafe each morning. FYI, housekeeping will also bring up a coffee maker to your room upon request but the coffee downstairs is much better and worth trekking down for. One disappointment is the pool itself. Really small pool (it's much smaller than the picture makes it out to be) and it is very cold... i couldn't go in but a few kids braved it and went in. Cabanas are nice -- the entire pool deck could use a face lift and a large group hot tub would be a great addition to the place. There is room for one. The 24 hour complimentary gym is great-- cold towels for your face after working out along with green apples. Way cool. Watch your face in the elevator... funny and creative. You'll realize what I'm taking about once you are inside the elevator. :) Sunday brunch is a great deal for the areq. For 20.11 you get two courses. Show your SPG card and get 15% off your bill. We sat out by the water fall/pool and had a nice brunch. Food was tasty. Many folks have remarked about pricing. For those of you that don't want to spend $38 a night for Valet and don't mind walking a block, there is a garage that does overnight parking with in and out privileges for $14 a night (cash only, tax included). In addition, you can avoid the overpriced mini-bar by walking a few blocks to Trader Joes. There is also a Riteaid, CVS, Ralph's market, Wholefoods and even a Best Buy right near the hotel. We had a few drinks at the lounge bar but went to TJ's and brought back snacks, water and some wine to share with friends who were visiting us in our room. The hotel is laid back and didn't seem to have a problem with it. They also will bring up whatever extra glasses you need (just tip please!) We had a great lunch a Angelinos (6 min walk from the hotel, Yelp it). Family run and excellent food. $10 bucks gets you their daily pasta special (generous portion) and a salad. It was really good and I high recommend it. We walked around the area and it primarily caters to college students. Looks like some of the more expensive restaurants have gone under and there are lots of for lease signs out where retail shops used to be. You'll find plenty of burger and pizza joints, Starbucks, Peets, Subway, etc. I guess it is a sigh of the times. Need an ATM, they are close... you can easily walk to most places. If you have a car, be sure to check out Nook Bistro. It's about a 15 min drive from the hotel but the food is amazing. Small place and reservations are highly recommended. If you have an iPhone, download the Nook app and you can win a free drink or desert. Very creative idea. Popular place -- we couldn't get a reservation but went anyway and had to beg to get in... it worked, barely. :) Heading over to West Hollywood? Traffic is a nightmare, especially on Wilshire. Make sure allow ample time to get around during rush hour. Ok, I think I've rambled on enough. This place is worth it. Thank you Ren and your amazing staff for a wonderful time and excellent service. You truly are a "star" in Hollywood.

Reviews.Title: “I felt like royalty”
Reviews.Author: cmp_11
Reviews.Content: I'd heard that staying at the W in Westwood is amazing, but, as with most travel, I had to see it for myself to heartily agree. It's not often that the hotel itself is such a grand destination, but such is the case with the W. The service was spectacular. I felt like royalty the way our every whim was promptly and eagerly met. The rooms were comfortable and spacious, and the location was ideal. But it's the service I'll remember most. "What is your wish?" was not only the telephone greeting, but the essence of the entire staff, especially Shin with valet. His knowledgeable, friendly help (and great sense of humor) made me feel like an LA resident instead of a tourist. My only regret was that we couldn't stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but unsympathetic front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: V Traveler
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at the W for a few days while our infant daughter was at UCLA Medical Center. Very close to the hospital complex there, and in fact we found it easier/faster to walk back and forth rather than deal with valet parking and the associated waits for the car at each place. Far cheaper to leave the car at the medical center too - $11/day there for valet parking compared to $35/day at the W. Our room was fine, but it was right next to the elevator so we were awakened 2-3 times per night by loud guests waiting for the elevator or coming out of one. Annoying. The pillows were horrible – only flat pillows with no support. And there were only 3 pillows in the room, so both of us couldn’t double up. Good mattress, but was still sore each morning because of the pillows. The bathroom was nice, although the plumbing under the sink was ugly/exposed. Great shower and good toiletries. Annoying charge for internet. Our last day we weren’t going to know until 3 or 4pm whether our daughter would be released from the hospital. I mentioned the situation to the front desk staff and they weren’t even a little sympathetic – I was told that I needed to let them know by 10 or 11am if we needed the room another night. They confirmed that they had plenty of availability, but still gave no leeway. So we checked out before noon and sure enough found out later that we needed to stay over for one more night. Given the hassle of rechecking in and bringing luggage back we just slept at the hospital. If they had given us a little flexibility, they would have sold us a room for another night. Would I stay here again? Absolutely, given its proximity to UCLA Medical Center. But only because of that. Otherwise nothing special, and the ultra-hipster vibe gets old after a while.

Reviews.Title: “W Hotel. What a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: ncoutroulis
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in several W Properties so I was really looking forward to staying at this one. Much to my surprise, this hotel was subpar. Sure, the lobby looks great, as well it should for a W Hotel, but the rooms, (yes, i changed so had 2 rooms in two nights) were both very tired looking. They were big(ish), but that was about it. It reminded me of an older LA apartment building that was turned into a hotel, but was never really updated. At least not to the standards that the W brand advertises.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: WW90095
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W Westwood in early September and it was great as usual. I stay at this hotel every time I am in LA as it is nicely located between Beverly Hills and Santa Monica and close to Sunset Blvd action. W Staff is always nice, competent and always able to solve eventual issues or offer advice regarding places and services I might need. The hotel has all the amenities one might need for a city stay: good gym, great pool with excellent service and the Whisky Blue for a quick drink. W Westwood is probably less glamourous than the W Hollywood recently, but on the other side it has a better location, at least for business purposes. A special mention to the W's Doormen, always kind, helpful and smiling, they certainly reflect the attitude of one of them who always says "Life is Good". W Westwood is definitely worth a visit

Reviews.Title: “Roomy and stylish room in Westwood”
Reviews.Author: BigBlueOcean7
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our very spacious suite. I think all the rooms are suites. The staff was very helpful and friendly and the room was clean and had some great amenities like DVD player, stereo, a spacious desk, sofas. The restaurant was a little pricey and they only had 1 high chair so we had to wait for another one but otherwise, the staff there was friendly and the food was great.

Reviews.Title: “Great property, Great enviornment and Great People make for a Great experience at the W Westwood.”
Reviews.Author: jwg333
Reviews.Content: The W Westwwod is nesteled in a beautiful neigboorhood in Westwood Village, walking distance frome the UCLA campus, fine and casual dining and fun shopping options. The hotel property is contemporary, very well maintained and the rooms are spacious with the ultimate heavenly bed. What makes the hotel so special, however are the people - from Ren the General Manager, to Elizabeth at the welcome desk, to DJ at curb side, to Mosses at Nine Thirty resturant and then finally to Shin Baranek at wheels who always has my car ready in the morning and helps to start my day off with a smile - It's the warm and caring people at the W Westwood that make this a Hotel one to cherish!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to stay again”
Reviews.Author: Earlham99
Reviews.Content: We traveled to LA to visit friends over the holidays. Our 1 yr old son is very active and on arrive the attendant asked if we would like to have the corners of the tables padded. So thoughtful! The bed was very comfortable and the suite was great so could put the baby down and still be able to converse in the living room. I will definitely be staying in a W hotel in the future.

Reviews.Title: “The staff made it great”
Reviews.Author: luxurytax
Reviews.Content: Vince at the Welcome Desk rocked! He was informative, fast, and he was even able to get me checked in early because a room was available. He had to change my room to do so and my ammenity didnt arrive. I know he advised IRD because he did it via walkie talkie in front of me. No biggie. He's a cool charecter with a accent better than my own. Wheels staff was fast evrytime, despite it raining all day for 4 days... my heart went out to them. The room wallpaper made me ill. Get rid of it the room is better w/o. Loved the room size and one bedroom. Style was fast with my request and i opened the door to smiling faces. Parking fee is higher than NYC... wonder why? great stay

Reviews.Title: “Modern, quiet street, clean, good eating close by.”
Reviews.Author: BrisbaneMegan
Reviews.Content: Stayed 24/12 checking out 27/12. We arrived quite early in morning after arriving from Australia, staff helped us to room on early check in which was wonderful. Hotel is modern, staff are helpful. We had 18 yr old daughter with us, she slept in second room/office on sofa bed. Complimentary coffee and tea downstairs each morning at Nine-Thirty each morning a nice treat. Top spot for quick or extended stay. Plenty of eating spots close by, 24 hr Pharmacy, Bebe, Victoria's Secret and others. I would come again to stay.

Reviews.Title: “W in Westwood: Wow”
Reviews.Author: GGOT
Reviews.Content: Came here for a a long weekend to celebrate my husband's birthday and it was one of the most comfortable hotels we have ever stayed in. The staff is top notch and there was never a moment when our every needs were not only met but anticipated. The location is fantastic - within walking distance of Westwood and great shops, markets and restaurants. There is complimentary coffee and tea in the AM, yummy robes and the overall look of the hotel is warm and inviting. The room was tastefully appointed and I agree with the previous reviewer who commented on the beds - they are dreamy. My only complaint is that I think they can do better on their Christmas tree in the lobby....it looks like it came out of a shopping mall - yes it is square but perhaps the decorations can be improved upon. Other than that, thanks to the entire staff who made us feel very at home.

Reviews.Title: “i rather sleep on my dogs bed”
Reviews.Author: nana163
Reviews.Content: From the minute that we came in no one helped us with our bags, they were very nonchalant about it. When we got to the front desk to check in the front desk clerk was very rude. She did not have a clue to what she was suppose to do. Unfortunately I checked in at 11:30 pm I was so tired all I wanted to do was go to my room and go to sleep. to my surprise I woke in the morning with a massive asthma attack, watery eyes and uncontrollably sneezing. I decided to explore what I had missed the night before and all I found was a dirty shower head, dirty air vents which did not allow me to sleep due to the amount of incredible noise it was making. dusty bed frames AND A COLD EEZ UNDER RIGHT UNDER MY BED. I had expected a trendy and chic room but what I got was a hot mess. that was not was worth my money, if your planning on staying here bring your own dust buster, clorox wipes, hell just bring all your cleaning supplies. P.S. the beds are made for Umpa lumpas, I'm 5'4 and my feet were hanging over.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, Funky and Hip”
Reviews.Author: TravelingFam3
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, we had a suite, which meant a separate living room space from the bedroom which was very nice. During the winter they had turned their pool into an ice rink which I thought was a great touch. The bar was fun and had a great vibe. My only complaint was the front desk agent was very rude upon check in, our reservation had been lost (even though we had a confirmation in hand) and it appeared to him to be an inconvenience to rebook us. Other than that I found it to be a very nice place and would return.

Reviews.Title: “See & Be Seen”
Reviews.Author: VegasGirl22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W with 3 friends on a girls trip to LA. It was our first time on the west coast and we were wowed when we walked into the lobby of the W. We were a little worried about being crammed into a room since there was 4 of us, but our room was beautiful and had plenty of space. The separate living room area was perfect for us because we could close the door to the beds if someone was sleeping. Decor was gorgeous, beds were SO comfortable. The lobby was beautiful and we took some great group pictures down there. The pool was a little small, but it was a little too chilly to swim when we were there anyway. The employees at the front desk weren't too friendly, but the valet and the doormen made up for it because they went above and beyond to make sure we knew where we were going and gave us great recommendations for nightlife/restaurants. The hotel was a bit pricey, but that was the advantage of going with 4 girls, we were able to split the cost and it was then more affordable for us. I LOVED this hotel and can't wait to stay here again. We even saw Randy Jackson in the lobby one morning!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Sleep Ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: IHEARTLA_4EVA
Reviews.Content: This truely is amazing! I stayed there with my partner and her sister, we had the Mega Suite, it is the only suite that has 2 bedrooms. And OMG that room was HUGE!!!!! There was a Master Room with King bed and the most comfortable bed ever! with our own private lounge/retreat area, master bathroom with a TV in there, cos you know you need a TV when your having your bath (which was amazing as well!) Then there was second room, it had its own TV and queen bed with own bathroom. I honstely couldn't of asked for a better room. The service was great, we ordered room service twice and both times they said that the food would be ready within half an hour and it was. And absolutley delish! We used their car service which was perfect! The Acura is very comfortable and will take you anywhere within reason and it was free (a tip to the driver wasn't an issue at all as he had great knowledge of the LA area and was very helpful) There is not one fault with this hotel and i will recommend it to everyone! If you do stay there, you love the elevators, they are hilarious!! I can't wait to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “comfort and calm in westwood"”
Reviews.Author: lilac1972
Reviews.Content: W Westwood was a great alternative to the typical LA experience. Tucked away near UCLA at first sounds far from the action, but the laid back feel, spacious rooms, excellent service makes me happy to have been their guest. Rooms were clean and comfortable and had a modern but relaxed feel almost like it was your own apartment. Especially enjoyed the lamps, so many of them, the light at night was soft and gave the room a mellow feel. Attentive staff for pretty much any need. Have been to many W hotels, this one, has a different, more mature, elegant feel than many of the others, perfect near a college campus. The local restaurants were also great and if you like sushi you should not miss Tengu.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: lcamp63
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my daughter while visiting relatives in the LA area. The rooms were very clean, comfortable and very stylish. The location was central to all that we did and close to hollywood and beverly hills. The service was outstanding throughout our stay. Food was also very good. I would highly recommend staying at this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel and great service”
Reviews.Author: eleele1
Reviews.Content: Thank you so much for the beautiful room and a great location, but more than that we truely appreciate the front desk clerk that was there when we checked in. She was more than professional and knowledgeable. We sometimes forget what service means in this day and age when people have been cut back and the others need to work longer and harder. I think its the employees that make the business, and you are very lucky to have her. I'm sorry I didn't get her name. Thank you again for a short but wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Room was suprisingly large - a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: LSfromNYC
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the W for one night at the W on a business trip. Instead of the closet sized room I have experienced at other W hotels, the room was a suite with a spacious living area and a bedroom just big enough for the king sized bed. The desk was very large and great for spreading out. The desk chair was comfortable. Desk lighting was ok but not great. The room service menu was more interesting than most, and the fish tacos were delicious.
