The location was good for my needs -- near gyms (an Equinox! as well as having their own), restaurants, coffee shops etc. There's a Bliss Spa there which I wish I had had time to use. The only glitch was trying to print my boarding pass - no machine available to guests; instead a concierage who for some reason had a lot of trouble getting and printing my boarding pass. The decor is that trendy W look, which is also a tad cheap looking (think of all the furnishings being purchased at West Elm), but clever and functional. I loved the Bliss bath products and the rain shower head. I look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Europe-07-09-11
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in most every respect. Rates were reasonable and the room should have been called a suite. Nice in every respect. Very expensive once there. A beer is $11 with tip. Cheapest bottle of wine is about $40 with tip. Dinner is $60 w/out drinks. All in all though a very solid and enjoyable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly,low key,understated in a great neighbourhood.”
Reviews.Author: lovenyc81
Reviews.Content: Loved the W Westwood.Staff are so friendly, they deserve all the praise they get! The hotel itself is lovely, great atmosphere and amazing staff. My only criticism would be the hotel looks a little worse for wear.The pool area needs to be looked at, the cushions etc are worn and stained. The Bathroom of our huge suite was too small, and a bit of a let down.....a low pressure shower above a bath with a shower curtain is not very luxurious and needs to be updated. The Bathroom at the W Hollywood (which I realise is a brand new hotel) was very impressive, separate shower and huge bath complete with marble counter tops etc gives the luxurious feel I'd expect from a suite bathroom. The charge for using the internet is also ridiculous...£7.95 for 15 minutes!!!!!! You can stay at a lower end hotel/motel and use complimentary internet, i think this is a major over sight of the Starwood chain!Its very frustrating and overheard a lot of guests in each of the W hotels we stayed at complaining about this! I think the staff work hard to make your stay memorable and deserve praise.

Reviews.Title: “Funky hotel, but not great for business travelers.”
Reviews.Author: DCtraveler2010_10
Reviews.Content: While the hotel atmosphere was exotic and high-end, I was disappointed that the hotel did not have a business center. There was a kiosk in the lobby that allows guests to use a computer for 15 minute intervals for $7.95. When the computer times out, it deletes your file. I lost my PowerPoint presentation as a result. Because the hotel contracts with an outside vendor, nobody at the front desk was able to help. Also, I ordered breakfast the night before and they lost my order, so breakfast never arrived. The next morning, they brought my cereal, but forgot the milk. Then, when I went down to the gym in the morning, there was a long wait for the cardio machines. It would be a nice hotel if the management could work out the kinks.

Reviews.Title: “BEST hotel in L.A.”
Reviews.Author: kimmikens
Reviews.Content: The staff cannot be beat anywhere in the United States. I have been to just about every major city there is in the US and hands down this hotel takes the cake. The location is the best spot in the entire Los Angeles area. It is in the middle of anything you would want to get to. Hollywood to the East, Santa Monica to the West, and great Brentwood and Westwood within walking/jogging distance. The access to the 405 and the 10 is unrivaled. The nightlife is just an elevator's ride to the lobby. The pool is fantastic and you can drink from dawn til dusk til dawn again! LOL. I loved it so much!!1 I will never stay anywhere else when I'm in LA

Reviews.Title: “W Westwood puts the WOW in W Hotels”
Reviews.Author: juddandrea
Reviews.Content: I became a huge "W" fan about 4 years ago, and that was solely based on my first stay at the W Westwood. Now If I can find a W, that's where I am staying. I have stayed at the W Westwood many times since. I love this hotel, I love the people, the neighborhood and the location. Everyone at the hotel is always so friendly and accommodating. Anything I need or want is just a phone call away. They really go out of their way to make sure their guests are taken care of and happy. I always start my day there with breakfast and coffee from room service, and I absolutely love it. I have also eaten in the restaurant Nine Thirty, which is downstairs. The service and staff there is incredible and the food amazing. The hotel has always made arrangements for a car service from and to the airport for me. (It's not part of your room rate people :-) But it is awesome. The driver is always there waiting, and always on time for pick up. There is nothing better after flying from the East Coast than to have someone pick up my luggage and drive me to the hotel, it's so carefree. Their concierge staff is without a doubt the best. Their verbiage is "Whatever/Whenever", and they are not kidding. They will work tirelessly to help fulfill your every wish or need, and with a smile. I have had several services at the Bliss Spa in the hotel, and well, what can I say - They were heavenly and worth every penny. I could go on and on....... I must say A SPECIAL THANKS to Ren, Cliff, Richie, Erica and Maribel who went above and beyond for me and made my trip so wonderful! You all took such great care of me and I couldn't thank you or express my appreciation enough. I will most certainly be back just as soon as I can, and as always, refer all my friends there too.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families with a dog”
Reviews.Author: sheri2420
Reviews.Content: The room was sensational but expected that. I was truly impressed with how nice all the staff was to my little dog, Scrappy. The W in Westwood is a really luxurious hotel, that is also pet friendly.

Reviews.Title: “I love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Polli
Reviews.Content: For the cost of a hotel room you get a suite at this hotel. Two full rooms! Plus the public spaces, inside and out, are terrific. I stayed here in both February and August, and both times everything was great. Plus, this is an LA neighborhood you can walk around in. The hotel is walking distance to a Trader Joes, numerous restaurants, drug stores, nail salon, everything you could need. In addition, there is street parking overnight. You can only park for two hours after 8 am, but if you plan to be out and about during the day you do not have to pay for hotel parking. Of course they have a fitness center, but I swim laps and for $10 I was able to use an excellent nearby health club with lap pool. There's free coffee and tea in the lobby in the morning, which is also a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, cool vibe hotel”
Reviews.Author: EmilyCharlie
Reviews.Content: We booked our room late on the day of arrival. We managed to get for $320 a suite near the top of the hotel. All the amenities in the room that you would expect. First class. Great gym, pool, choice of bars/restaurants. We didn't leave. Pool has loud, cool music - so probably not suitable for older people who like peace and quiet. Pool-side staff very helpful frequently giving us cold, iced water and checking we were ok. We ate in the BackYard restaurant. Very good, friendly staff - although not the biggest portions which was surprising.

Reviews.Title: “I heard there was a great pool, too bad I couldn't use it.”
Reviews.Author: karenzara
Reviews.Content: I loved the room and the Bliss bath products were by far the best part of the stay. But I was really looking forward to unwinding by the pool when I woke up and was told that there was too long of a wait to be let in. If chairs can (and in this case should) be reserved, that is something that should be offered upon check-in if it's a hot day. You go to a hotel to relax and enjoy the amenities, not to have to be on a "list" to sunbathe. I would not recommend staying here when it's warm out since you can't use the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Escape to tranquility in LA”
Reviews.Author: HazemHussein
Reviews.Content: A quite and pleasant hotel snugly nested in a residential neighborhood. The pool garden is a nice and relaxing outlet for a light snack and some celebrity looking. I recommend the Apple Pizza (yes pizza!) with vanilla ice cream. Another plus is the assignment of an entire floor (the 9th) for smokers, including the corridors! Also there is a slim and sleek veranda surrounded by exotic trees for smoking overlooking the quite street entrance.

Reviews.Title: “Freezing”
Reviews.Author: gjfannarbor
Reviews.Content: Even though I booked a suite, we arrived to find both rooms at 61 and 63 degrees temperature. They moved us to another cold room (65 degrees.). They acknowledged there was no heating in the hotel and switched it on which took a couple of hours to warm up. Despite this, the same thing occurred the next night! It's bad enough to suffer from them saving money, but they also overcharge for everything. $5 for a 330ml bottle of water,i.e. $15 per liter!. Wireless service inthe room costs $14.95. Supposedly Starwood members get a 20% discount off food and beverages, - but not the overpriced breakfast. This is the worst "rip-you-off" hotel I have experienced for a long time, and would not be surprised if they install meters next year so guasts pay for toilet paper to be dispensed. This is not the usual quality for a Starwood hotel and we will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “We were treated like long lost friends”
Reviews.Author: beichnerR
Reviews.Content: I had brought my family along on a business trip and the front desk gave us a complimentary upgrade to a Fabulous Suite which amazed and impressed my teenage daughters (a VERY difficult task!) On top of that there was not a single interaction with a staff member at the hotel that was less than amazing. This has been the fourth time I have stayed at this hotel in the last year, with the last two times bringing along 4 other paying guests from my company, each visit I continue to be delighted. It is getting to the point where I will drive 30 miles to my meetings just to stay at this hotel. The rooms are large, the staff is courteous, and helpful, the restaurants are chic and the location is very central to the larger LA basin. I am a big fan of the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Great location; W-level service and comfort but without the usual W attitude.”
Reviews.Author: SirBowen24
Reviews.Content: This two-night business trip was my first visit to LA in over 15 years, and I am glad I chose the W. First, the location was great. My room looked out onto the UCLA campus -- but was still quiet -- and the area definitely had a neighborhood-ly feel. A short walk down the tree-lined mostly residential street brings you to several major thoroughfares, with shops and restaurants aplenty. Head up Weyburn Ave. three blocks to the intersection of Westwood Blvd and you'll be in an area that feels like a little college town. I-405 is only a few minutes away by car, and the trip to Santa Monica took about 15 or 20 minutes (much longer at rush hour). Staff at the hotel were all friendly, especially the desk and the parking valets - though watch out, the mandatory valet parking will set you back a pretty penny per night. (Whether you have a car or not, don't forget to take advantage of the free Acura shuttle service that will take you to local spots.) Service was as expected from a W, though I found the staff at this hotel (and the hotel in general) far less pretentious than say, the Atlanta W Midtown. The pancake breakfast downstairs was quite good, but definitely not worth the more than $25 with tax and tip. The room was clean and modern, and fairly spacious. My only complaint about the room was the lack of outlets anywhere close to the bed. So if you want to charge your phone overnight and leave it next to the bed you're out of luck (though the hotel did provide an industrial-strength extension cord when I asked). There's also a kiosk in the lobby for free printing of airline boarding passes. Finally, the big disappointment was the fitness center. While it is fairly well-equipped, with treadmills, bikes, ellipticals, balance balls, free weights and machines, it felt extremely cramped. It was also so dark the I couldn't even read the numbers printed on the machines' weight stacks (or the instructions). That was an annoyance, but could also be a safety issue and should be corrected. Overall, however, it was an enjoyable stay, and I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice when Hotels in Beverly Hills are full or Very Expensive”
Reviews.Author: getwhatudeserve
Reviews.Content: I like the W, staff is very attentive and cordial. However i can never make the A/C work as desired. I dont know if its because its a very old building/system or if its the unit. Location is ok, very close to Century City, BH, Brentwood, Santa Monica, etc. I have stayed there 3 times during some years, always a hassle free stay.

Reviews.Title: “Expected More”
Reviews.Author: 28970Ann
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the W for one week and found the hotel to be very overrated for many reasons: (1) pool is small and usually crowded (2) gym is basic but they have new equipment (3) valet parking can be very slow in the AM (4) lobby had a funky smell. On the upside our hotel room was relatively quiet and the products (bliss) are heavenly. Don't believe the hype.

Reviews.Title: “When in doubt, GO W ! You can't go wrong”
Reviews.Author: petermcadams
Reviews.Content: We are great fans of the W Hotels, an had a chance to stay at the W in LA last year. As always, the W in LA lives up to it amazing standards. Having stayed at the W in various other locations around the world, we felt that this W was by far the best of the lot. From the Bar downstairs ( which plays amazing music by the way ), to the lobby ( which offers various board games ) to the rooms, W never fails to impress us. As we were on our honeymoon, the friendly staff immediately offered us a complimentary upgrade! Making our stay one to remember. We are W addicts for life! When in doubt, go W !

Reviews.Title: “Too much Business...not enough fun”
Reviews.Author: LuvH2O_44
Reviews.Content: The overall stay was ok, we were not in the room very much, but were able to hang out at the pool for a few hours. It was our intention to relax by the pool and we planned on spending some money at pool bar for food and drinks. When we got downstairs, there was security at the pool that told us that we were only allowed 4 lounge chairs per room. we had 7 people with us, 4 of which were staying at the hotel and 3 that were locals. Right off the bat, this made us extremely uncomfortable. We ended up having 3 girls sit by the pool (on the ground) and we managed to sit on a couch that was nearby without anyone complaining. I think that they should have been more willing to accomodate every guest, especially since we were paying good money for the room and we ended up having a $300 pool bar bill. Overall, it just put a sour taste in our mouth for the remainder of our stay. There was also an issue with the mini bar, where the prices were mis-marked, so we ended up paying more than double for those items. The suite we had was nice and the staff at the front desk were extremely friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch service made our stay superb!”
Reviews.Author: dgundli
Reviews.Content: Besides a great location near UCLA, the service was the best i have ever experienced. From the front desk to the housekeeping to the bellstaff, every face to face experience exceeded our expectations. We normally stay at Kimpton or Hilton chains but we have discovered a new jewel! The hotel was priced right and had exceptional amenities including a spectacular pool area. Are there things they could improve upon? Sure such as the room service food quality and price but I usually make this same comment about most hotels. The decor was modern which is not my favorite but a big wow on the electronics in our room including the Bose Wave, DVD player and flat panel HD televisions with a rich selection of channels. The bathrooms were wonderful too with a deep soaking tub and spa showerhead and i almost forgot, a tv too! I don't know if all the rooms have these amenities but we were quite impressed. I also loved that this was a pet friendly hotel - another great perk!

Reviews.Title: “Hip and attentive”
Reviews.Author: Chezmay
Reviews.Content: This is a stylish, fun hotel with many thoughtful touches. My wife and I stayed two nights for a weekend getaway, and although W gives off a too-cool vibe, we didn't feel out of place, and many families (some with pets) were staying there. (The Madrid soccer team and their media entourage were there too.) We had booked the least expensive room but were upgraded to a suite upon arrival because my wife had a Starwood Preferred Guest card. Our room was spacious and well-appointed, and the bed was firm and comfortable. The staff was almost eerily helpful. When I came back from a run one morning, no fewer than three members of staff offered me water before I even reached the front steps. I was wearing a large bandage on my wrist because of an earlier encounter with poison oak, and I mentioned to my wife that I needed to find a pharmacy to buy some more gauze. Later we found an envelope under our door containing the address of a nearby 24-hour pharmacy. My only gripe was that the restaurant was pricey, even by Westwood standards. Fifteen dollar cocktails seem to be the norm locally, but the food prices also seemed to be more than even the good local restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Decadently decorated, outstanding service and hospitality, "the" place to be”
Reviews.Author: ked44
Reviews.Content: For the discerning traveler, the "W" is the place to stay! A boutiquey trendy hotel with the luxuries of a five star resort. We enjoyed the luxurious spa, the state of the art fitness center as well as drinks in the beautiful indoor outdoor lobby area. The staff went out of their way to make our every wish come true. Highly recommended and we will return. Thank you to the W....

Reviews.Title: “There's so much attention to detail, yet the ultimate result is a very relaxing hotel.”
Reviews.Author: ParisLaJolla_CA
Reviews.Content: Pluses: We were using our week-end free night. Even so, we got a Platinum upgrade to a fabulous suite. Starwood treats its loyal clientele well, which we appreciate. This W is truly comfortable and well-appointed. We've stayed there several times, and enjoy the inviting and well-designed common areas, the lush garden and pool, and the spacious, well-appointed rooms. Minus: My favorite news channel, MSNBC, was not available. This is one of my few complaints with some Starwood properties. It should be a rule that if you carry Fox News you should balance this by also carrying MSNBC. If you can't carry both, then just have CNN, which is right in the middle of the political spectrum.

Reviews.Title: “Still a good place, needs some friendlier staff”
Reviews.Author: islascaribe
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the W Westwood numerous times and although I like the rooms, the ambiance and the location as well as the food, there are some issues now. I have found on my last 2 stays that the staff is not as friendly as they used to be and there is a certain level of pretentiousness that is not welcoming at all. Maybe it is the location, near Hollywood, which causes the "better than" attitude, but I wish they would work on it. One other complaint is the cost of the parking at $26/night and the cost of the internet, simply too high. Overall, if you can avoid the staff (with the exception of the maid staff, who were warm and pleasant), this is still a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “We loved staying in a great hotel in a quiet, beautiful location!”
Reviews.Author: tbonifay
Reviews.Content: My husband and I brought my father-in-law to visit family who recently moved to Los Angeles and live near the W Los Angeles. We were pleased with the friendly and prompt attentiveness of the staff. Our Penthouse room was gorgeous and spacious--we liked the modern style! The lobby was elegant and interesting, and it was fun to walk to a nice restaurant for dinner and "come home" and feel VERY pampered!

Reviews.Title: “A Pleasant Surprise”
Reviews.Author: gmc1963
Reviews.Content: Had a fantastic experience at the W Westwood, which I booked at the last minute when I was unable to stay with friends while in LA for a conference. The staff was friendly and the service was wonderful - they upgraded me to a suite. Loved the decor and spacious, comfortable accommodations, particularly given the relatively reasonable price. The hotel was a sanctuary, after a long, stressful day, and it was convenient to my conference in Santa Monica and to restaurants and shops in West Hollywood and Beverly Hills. I will probably stay there again on my next trip to LA this summer.

Reviews.Title: “Wow the W was Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: mrsmalibu
Reviews.Content: It started on the phone with Richard Chandler in-house reservations - setting us up with a fantastic suite for our whole family. We worked with him before and think he is so fabulous! He just makes everything better! Than we arrive to the amazing valet guys - Wheels! They are so nice and call us by name. I wanted to take them home with me. Loved eating by the pool. Love the margerita pizza! Perfect spot to walk to dinner, movies and shopping in Westwood. Beautiful botanical UCLA gardens to walk through across the street. Thanks again Richard C- You Rock!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Neighborhood Location”
Reviews.Author: sfcafox
Reviews.Content: I was surprised to find out the W Westwood sits smack in the middle of a Los Angeles neighborhood adjacent to UCLA. My first thoughts were, who would stay here but with close proximity to UCLA, I now get it. It was actually nice to be in a quiet neighborhood away from all the noise of the city, but yet still with all the W vibe you'd expect. The pool was great, a total scene depending what day of the week you go. The rooms are ginormous, with all the modern W amenities you'd expect.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful room, Great location, beware of extra fees!”
Reviews.Author: TheDudenmeister
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at W in Westwood to pick our son up from his UCLA orientation. We switched our reservation from a different Westwood Hotel to the W since we brought our dog with us and they advertise as "pet friendly". They do list the pet fees on their website if you look under PAWs info, but we didn't see that, and were not told at check-in that the pet fees would total $125. Also, weren't told when making reservations of the $35 parking fee. The pet fees wouldn't be so bad spread over cost of a week long reservation, but for one night- our unexpected fees totaled $160. Thank goodness we talked them out of charging us $25 extra for a rollaway bed when they moved us from our reserved room with 2 Dbls to a room with one King bed (only double rooms left were smoking rooms when we checked in at 4pm). Next time we will leave the dog at home if we stay at the W. Our room was lovely, very quiet, beds comfortable. We did not eat at the hotel. Pool is wading depth (4ft), not great for lap swimming- Mostly for those who like to lounge around the pool setting; lots of lounge chairs and cabana tents. Super close and convenient (walkable) to UCLA and Westwood eateries.

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE, but a they take you on some extra prices...”
Reviews.Author: Malibu2260
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice, refreshing, and had a very modern feel to it's atmosphere. The beds were excellent, and the staff were very attentive and helpful. When I said that they take you on extra prices, I was mainly talking about how they charged extra for room wi-fi, and had very tempting snacks and drinks placed in their rooms but many of them were over priced. Otherwise, they had the best room design and maid service. Lastly, they have very good concierges, and valet parking staff. To my surprise, I noticed that most of the clientele were a little more dressed up than usual. (BEWARE: Parking is around $35.00 a day, even though it's not widely advertised.) THE STAFF is the best part about the the parking though...

Reviews.Title: “A Slightly Different W that didn't fail to Deliver!!!”
Reviews.Author: Novemberbravo1974
Reviews.Content: The W Westwood in Los Angeles is almost Boutique W than the larger W properties I have encountered previously. Located on the fringe of the UCLA campus in Westwood this Hotel enjoys a good location for both walking and also driving being only a few mins drive from one of the major freeways ( 405 I think ) which has an off-ramp off Wilshire Blvd. As there is almost no street parking if you dislike Valet Parking forget this place, however I had no issue using the valet and found the service efficient and friendly. At $30 per day it may be considered expensive but not excessive in my view. The Hotel has all the features standard to a W, It’s a little smaller so there is only 1 bar ( quite nice with a good cocktail menu and wide range of booze for late night drinking ) and 1 restaurant choice in house. There is a gym, pool, day spa and other such facilities tucked away within so your not going without if the need arises on any front. The Room I booked was a Suite, I was surprised by the size with a very sitting room and smaller bedroom and small but usable bathroom that probably is due to refurb in the next year or so but was still immaculately clean and well presented at all times. The Rooms décor is typical W its chic, cool, unusual even zany in places. The huge swing arm lamp looked like something from a shipyard, There was ample lounge space, closets and a useful if seemingly large desk. There was two fine big screen LCDs and a Ipod dock and sound system. Service was welcoming and friendly, The front desk folks even suggested not to change money at the hotel unless it was a dire emergency given the unfavourable rates they where compelled to offer. Despite the renovations going on during our stay to the reception area it was always very orderly and quite efficient. The W Westwood is a great little hotel, It’s cool its individual style and its atmosphere make it stand out a little more than other properties in the chain fortunately for all the right reasons. A good effort and a good choice for a stay in Los Angeles.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with this W”
Reviews.Author: sammielc
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at Starwood and W chains around the world, I have been disappointed with my experience with the hotel. On the positive the hotel room was clean, comfortable. However I did not appreciate waking up to someone elses alarm clock, room doors banging, although I had a suite I could hear in high clarity what was going on outside my room. Access to wifi was at $15 per 24hr period. The hotel main restaurant was closed on a Friday night. The only place to eat was outside, which frankly wasn't that warm to enjoy dinner outside. The food is very over priced, pretentious and in mini portions. The staff came across like they care whether you enjoyed your stay or not. Howvever the bliss spa was tremendous as ever...

Reviews.Title: “Ask for Shin in Wheels”
Reviews.Author: Redbiz
Reviews.Content: Always stay at this hotel to attend annual industry conference. I am the driver for my corporate group and am admittedly a bit dierctionally challenged. Shin in wheels made sure every morning that I knew how to reach my destination and even gave me some wonderful shortcut routes to avoid L.A. traffic. Shin took excellent care of me and was the constant hotel contact for me throughout my annual stays at this hotel. I was so impressed with his kind and courteous service, that I wrote a glowing letter about this very professional employee to the hotel's G.M. last year.

Reviews.Title: “awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: pureoxygenfacial
Reviews.Content: hotel location was superb, within westwood, walking distance to restaurants, shopping and grocery stores. couldn't have asked for more in terms of the staff, Shin in valet along with T.J. and Kinsey, so helpful and courteous. The staff in the restaurant and breakfast service were great as well. the hotel is clean, new, and lively. this is where you want to stay. pool was fabulous too.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in West LA”
Reviews.Author: mds2010
Reviews.Content: Top notch hotel all around. From the friendly staff: Shin in the Wheels department and DJ there to greet you when you drive up, to the great restaurant and lively bar scene. I'm lucky enough to stay here a few times a month and always look forward to it. When you go, grab a drink and/or dinner at the Backyard restaurant. In the summer it's a great place to go to spot celebs!

Reviews.Title: “I stay here at least a few times per month for work.”
Reviews.Author: CocoFranco
Reviews.Content: I am an SPG member and this hotel is just a few miles from my office so it makes sense to stay at the W when I schlep up to L.A. and work long hours. The rooms, service, and style of this hotel are fantastic. No complaints. You will make the right choice by staying here if you're coming to Los Angeles. My only gripe is the price of parking my car with the hotel, which I must remove from my expense reports and pay out-of-pocket because I don't want to charge my firm (or my clients for that matter) $32.00 for parking my car. I think 20.00 per night is reasonable for L.A. but anything more than that is really pushing it. Also, a jacuzzi would be nice, but the pool area is gorgeous, so it's ok. Remember that you can only get free internet in the lobby; it costs something like 15.00 if you want it in your room. Otherwise, stay here, you'll be glad you did!

Reviews.Title: “Not superb as expected from a Starwood property”
Reviews.Author: jessb04
Reviews.Content: Perfect setting- cute surroundings. Service not prestine. Asked if we would like newspaper delivered- said yes. After not receiving first morning, reminded following day- again did not receive it and gave up. AC in bedroom did not cool very well. Sat in bar common area- not in bar with our 14 year old son. Ordered drinks and food off menu- did not allow my son to eat burger from outside of hotel, yet we weren't in the bar due to my son's age. If we are ordering and spending a generous amount of money, we should have been allowed some flexibility as guests. Staff could have been more discrete when told about this. Notified staff that we were leaving food in hall to keep room from smelling, following morning food was still out there. Not what you'd expect to experience at a Starwood hotel. Great hotel- far from perfect service.

Reviews.Title: “I keep coming back!”
Reviews.Author: mishottie
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this location on 5 or more occassions and I have written one great review many years ago. I haven't been back in a almost 2 years because I haven't had business in the area, but I recently experienced the W in Hollywood and had a dissapointing stay. I am now returning to the Westwood location, as my daughter has an internship in Santa Monica and has been commuting, so I am taking a few days off work and getting a room here. After staying at the Hollywood W, I have a greater appreciation for the Westwood location. I have always been welcomed with friendly, unpretentious attitude here and almost always upgraded as an SPG Gold Member. I won't stay anywhere else again, even if I have to drive a little further for what I'm in town for - the service is excellent and they make me feel like a valued guest. It took me some time and a horrible experience at W Hollywood to write another review - if you are a young, wanna-be, party all night long guest that doesn't need sleep, then don't stay here, but if you like the quaintness of Westwood and want to feel comfortable and relax in a classy enviroment that isn't over the top, then this is the hotel choice for you. I have enjoyed every stay and hope that my upcoming visit in July is no exception! W - keep up the good work! P.S. The Bliss Spa addition is great and I enjoyed my treatments very much, too!

Reviews.Title: “New Found Love for Westwood LA”
Reviews.Author: thesun01
Reviews.Content: I absolutely enjoyed myself at the W Westwood, the staff was so welcoming & accomodating from the time that I arrived until I departed! I loved the area & the suite, fitness center, & pool were the icing on the top! A pleasant gentlemen (I forgot his name), tall / grey hair suggested a restaurant for us to try for breakfast "Snug Harbor"...It was delicious! I can't say enough great things & I can't wait to return!!!!!! I work in the hospitality industry in Las Vegas and I am a stickler for exceptional customer service, if you feel that say way...stay at the "W Westwood LA!" The End :}

Reviews.Title: “my favorite place to stay in los angeles - best staff, service and spa”
Reviews.Author: tomcavage
Reviews.Content: I love everything about the W Westwood, From the minute I arrive -- everyone in Wheels, especially Shin, TJ, Kinsey and Manny, make me feel so comfortable and welcome. The hotel, restaurants and rooms are just perfect. The service is always professional and flawless. I love Bliss Spa. Mary, Amy, Drew, Dolly and Michael know just what I like and remember me each visit. I look forward to my next trip -- it cant come soon enough.

Reviews.Title: “fabulous for us (minus sleep, loud conv at 2 am below room).”
Reviews.Author: camisaliba
Reviews.Content: usually fantastic. we take our two kids and get them own room. one is 18 so they go to movie on sunday evening by pool. did not enjoy their time, other guests were loud and rude. but we did. teenagers!!!!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING, AMAZING, AMAZING!”
Reviews.Author: Aloha0402
Reviews.Content: WOW! The W Hotel is an amazing hotel! What stood out the most was the service! All the staff at the hotel were very friendly and helpful. Especially, Shin who works in the wheels/valet department! He acted like he was the concerige for the hotel. He gave us directions to different tourist attractions and make sure we knew about the best restaurants in the area. We found ourselves going to Shin for all our needs, there wasn't one thing he couldn't answer!!!! I will definetely return to the W Hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Okay for a night or two”
Reviews.Author: smizraim
Reviews.Content: The parking charge of $32.00 a day was ridiculous, but this spot was nice for a one night stay. We had a suite which was comfortable, but it felt like a dressier Marriott and I was expecting something a little more unique and upscale. Also the drinking glasses in our room were nasty and obviously had not been cleaned which made us leery of the overall, thorough cleanliness of the facility. Also, the sink in our bathroom did not have a good drain. This was our first time staying in a W Hotel. While we weren't totally disappointed with our stay, we did wonder how nice other hotels were in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service All Around!!!”
Reviews.Author: weijb27
Reviews.Content: The service at the W in Westwood, CA has some of the the best service I've seen. The employees at all the departments are very courteous. The people who really stand out are Shin, TJ, and Kinsey from the wheels/valet department are awesome!

Reviews.Title: “W - Westwood: he perfect place to stay in LA”
Reviews.Author: beheerenow
Reviews.Content: We had such a great time staying here at the W. The service was amazing and we truly enjoyed the staff in the pool area. We do wish the hotel bar had better event promotions and djs. It's a great space and its a shame to come back for the last hour to only 8 people in the place on a Friday or Saturday night. Everything of the W was fantastic... we will definitely be back again. :)

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel, Great Amenities, Helpful (but Pretentious) Staff”
Reviews.Author: GrazPop
Reviews.Content: This is a superb hotel. My room was logically laid out, with all sorts of amenities, and beautifully decorated. There's an endless supply of electronic goodies as well (iPod charger, DVD player, etc.) The hotel bar was pricey but just plain fantastic: superb service, exceptional quality. And you can't beat the location if you need to be near UCLA or Westwood. The only thing I found amusing was the staff's requirement of answering the phone in a faux-cool way, saying "what is your wish?", instead of the standard "how can I help you?" I wanted to tell them "I'd love to be invisible, or maybe to fly like a condor". Anyway, it's a terrific place to stay, with my only gripe that one night, people across the street were making a heck of a racket, and I found it hard to get to sleep. Not the hotel's fault, obviously.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel experience ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: benchmarktravel
Reviews.Content: I cannot believe previous reviews on here for this hotel. HORRIBLY expensive for the quality of this room. NO shelf space for anything. Only can hang clothing. Showerhead blew off when I turned it on. Water pressure is almost non-existent. The room is so sterile and bizzare I cannot understand why anyone would pay $300 plus for it. The book that explains the hotel fell apart when I opened it up. There is no information in the room on the 2 restaurants on the property. NEVER NEVER again. Should have stayed at the Hotel Palomar nearby for 1/2 the price.

Reviews.Title: “hotel triste et déprimant”
Reviews.Author: smart-world
Reviews.Content: I don't recommend this hotel. the design is oldfashion. Bathroom are small and oldfashion. Beds are very bad. Don't expect any assistance from the staff and no more smile from them.. The W westwood is sad in the athmosphere. Rooms are very dark and sad for almost 50% of the room, without any view. Any one of the staff will care if you enjoy your stay or not. If you're looking especialy for a W hotel, you must go to the W Hollywood which is wonderfull, very well located and very fashion with very nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Very Cool and nice”
Reviews.Author: GOGGIO
Reviews.Content: Definitely a beatiful and cool hotel. The service is fantastic and the person in the reception are absolutely polite and they taking care for everything you need

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: LizUS
Reviews.Content: I stayed at W for three nights. During check in we discovered that we were staying on a smoking floor. Unfortunately the hotel was not aible to give us a room on a non smoking floor. Even though we were given an extra filter in our room the smoke was still noticeable. We enjoyed our stay at the W and definitily will be back. W is Wonderfull and I just love it. I am a fan!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for Business and Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: mnasf
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during a one night stay while working in Century City. The check-in took a little while, but the person at the front desk was so nice and helpful. She spent extra time making sure everything was just right with my stay. She told me that I had been upgraded to a suite (bonus) and that I would get a 20% discount on room service of food at the restaurant. They were doing a little work on the hotel while I was there, but I hardly noticed. The bed was very comfortable. The room service food was fast and tasty. The room was set up for business travelers. If I am ever in the area again on business I will stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here for a long weekend. Service...”
Reviews.Author: RFNJ
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a long weekend. Service was very friendly, rooms were clean and comfortable, but there were little nicks and scratches which showed their age. I had a fabulous suite, which was very larger and well laid out. Room service was excellent, and what few requests were made (room cleaning early one day) were handled graciuosly. Location was a little secluded, but cabs were available (getting to Santa Monica about $17) one chintzy thing that was annoying: you can order 2 hours of music on the tv, which is great. The price:$15 which is rediculous. Also could do without the internet charge. I would happily stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a if you'd like to be a "local"”
Reviews.Author: bigDEE2010
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located in a residential neighborhood walking distance from UCLA. The vibe is totally residential mixed with college town (rich college town). The streets are quiet and safe and close to lots of dining choices by foot. My first stay was in December 09 during a visit to Studio City and I returned again because I liked that the hotel is conveniently located to major freeways, tourist attractions, and shopping centers without being in the middle of high traffic zones like downtown LA or Hollywood. I could be at LA neighborhood in less than 20 minutes. The rooms were spacious and very clean. Both times I stayed at The W Westwood the beds were very comfortable. Room service is a little slow but the food is excellent and worth the wait. This is not the location for a romantic getaway, although it can be, it is best for hanging around town, shopping, and mingling with the locals.

Reviews.Title: “Best customer service hands down!! Excellent facilities!!”
Reviews.Author: loholly
Reviews.Content: I would highly suggest staying at the W Hotel in LA (Westwood). This was our 2nd time visiting the hotel and we will return. The staff could not be more helpful and friendly. Whoever is training these folks deserves a special award. Their customer service skills are part of the reason we returned. If you want to feel special and be treated as a guest should, this is the hotel. Everyone we encountered was wonderful from the garage guys, to the pool to the front desk and room service staff, they made us feel welcomed and relaxed during our stay. The Hotel facilities are excellent. The pool is fantastic and don't miss the Bliss Spa, even if you only get the $25 mani, it's worth it. It's rare these days to receive such great hospitality, but this hotel has it together.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best W's in the US, Big Rooms”
Reviews.Author: ustehkc
Reviews.Content: The rooms are very nice at this hotel. Suite layout makes you feel like you are in your own condo in LA. On the campus of UCLA in Westwood with great jogging around the area. Pool area is nice. Friendly staff. This is the 3rd time I have stayed at the hotel and its a great place for a weekend or business travel. Tip: You get 20% off your meal and drinks at the restaurant if you show your Starwood points card. We would often go to the bar in the restaurant and order beer/wine at the disount to take back to our room.

Reviews.Title: “Cool hotel, but out of the way”
Reviews.Author: Frank21961
Reviews.Content: We were given a large suite, well furnished and decorated with great style. The lobby has great photographic art. The pool is really nice to lounge by. The Bliss spa is wonderful. However, there isn't much to do around the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: tscottr
Reviews.Content: Great central spot in LA area with friendly staff in a cozy, comfortable atmosphere. Walking distance to Westwood Village and UCLA campus.

Reviews.Title: “Will do it Again.”
Reviews.Author: Calexa44
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the W. All the staff made us feel welcome, and we would definitely recommend the W Westwood to all our friends and family traveling to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at W Westwood - Will be back!”
Reviews.Author: HollywoodMB
Reviews.Content: At first, I thought the location was questionable. After staying four nights at the new W Hollywood and two nights at the Bellagio in Vegas, everything was within steps of me. It was a pleasant surprise to find out how much there was in Westwood. Everything I needed to have a relaxing final two nights on the West Coast. The Staff was great and the room was fantastic - huge, clean and we kept. Once again, just another reason why I have all of my faith in and prefer the W brand! Keep up the great work!

Reviews.Title: “Uber Stylish Comfort but Charged for Every Little Thing!”
Reviews.Author: movinonbk
Reviews.Content: The W Westwood is a truly hip, fun and comfortable hotel. The rooms are decorated beautifully, the staff is sweet and accommodating without being cloying, the restaurants are yummy. It's stylish while still plush. BUT, and this is a big one for me, they charge for EVERY LITTLE ITEM. And they charge A LOT. $32 A DAY for parking, $35 per USE!!! for the steamroom (crazy i know), $15 per day for the internet. It was totally infuriating. I truly can't get over a luxury hotel charging guests to use the steamroom. Don't dinky motels provide spa amenities free of charge? It just feels cheap and mean. Until they change these pricing policies, I will stay away.

Reviews.Title: “It was good”
Reviews.Author: jmaddoxmusic
Reviews.Content: I expect a little more from a highly regarded hotel chain. The hotel looked like an old building that had a minimal cheap makeover to try to be chic. i think it may have missed the mark. It was somewhat fun and clean however the quality of the interior was spotty. It was old and not very nice. This particular hotel did not have many amenities. i expected more form the pool and gym. I received an upgraded room which was unexpected and nice. It was good size but again the doors and interior furniture looked cheap. The worst part of the stay was the fact that the only parking option cost $35 a day. I think that this is ridiculous especially after paying for a nice hotel, its an insult to charge that much to park in a hotel which you pay a premium to stay at. Other than that my overall experience was slightly better than good, but less than i expected from the W brand.

Reviews.Title: “Upscale without the attitude”
Reviews.Author: KTLNyc
Reviews.Content: One of the most comfortable and all round well run W's I have stayed in. Single traveling woman on business is hard to find it all. Very helpful without being pushy. Ate at the bar without being bothered. Great location and away from the glitzy part of West Hollywood. Very comfortable night.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Service.....I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: estieb57
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights and had a terrific stay at the W in Westwood, I highly recommend it. Everyone was so helpful and the room was great. I have to say , I slept like a baby, the beds are super comfy. Sexy , romantic. decor, even the elevator has unexpected surprise...we loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel....even better staff”
Reviews.Author: cgrakal
Reviews.Content: I love the W Westwood and as I travel often to Los Angeles it's great to have a place to stay that feels more like an apartment than an hotel. The staff is great and even the valet guys (Shin in particluar) go above and beyond with their service and friendliness. Stay at the W in Westwood and park you car with Shin!

Reviews.Title: “quiet and clean... valet parking is a wait.”
Reviews.Author: PamelaBalian
Reviews.Content: quiet and clean... valet parking is a wait. the service was good. just the valet was a wait and the street was small.

Reviews.Title: “A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!!!”
Reviews.Author: Textures
Reviews.Content: I had such a good time. I was in LA on business for 5 days and the stay at the W in Westwood was perfect. The staff was remarkable and unbelievably polite. I have to admit I was a little wary after reading some of the reviews from other people, but I am so glad I didn't pay attention to them. Once again, AMAZING. The only thing I didn't like was the $32 for mandatory valet parking and the charge for the internet. That was unnecessary.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Perfect Perfect”
Reviews.Author: mamaraquel
Reviews.Content: My hubby and I just stayed at the W last weekend.He was there for business and I was there for Leisure ;) Everyone was very helpful, from the valet services to the maid services! We had a great weekend! Thank you so much

Reviews.Title: “An absolute pleasure to stay here”
Reviews.Author: citygirl4616
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in LA for a long weekend. I had never been to LA, and a friend recommended this hotel. It is located in Westwood, right near the UCLA campus. Westwood is a pretty quiet residential neighborhood, with Westwood Village being just a 5 minute walk away. Pros: 1 - Beautiful hotel; modern, clean look; very LA! 2 - Spacious suites 3 - Excellent service all around (front desk, conceirge, housekeeping, valet) 4 - Beautiful poolside dining 5 - Bliss Spa on 2nd floor 6 - Great restaurants within walking distance Cons: 1 - Bathrooms have little counter space and no storage space. 2 - Could get loud if there is a party going on at the bar 3 - Tiny on-site gym 4 - Expensive ( I didn't comparison shop to other hotels in LA, but $35 a night for parking seems like a lot) I would definitely stay there again and recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the LA area.

Reviews.Title: “Wanna be only”
Reviews.Author: SixOceans
Reviews.Content: The good: *Nice view *Good location *Very friendly staff The bad: *Not kid friendly - The art deco style allows for sharp corners and glass at head height The ugly: *Elevator got stuck - Center elevator would go up to the 8th floor and stop (after a few minutes and by pressing all the buttons we got back to the lobby) *Internet slow - snails pace (at $15 per day, living in the days of the carrier pigeons would be faster) *Valet not knowledgeable - where's Pauley Pavillion from here, we asked? Neither valet had any idea, but the car was pulled out on time (for $35 per night they should be prompt) *Art deco – if you like art deco maybe you will enjoy the plastic chairs *Shower - the shower door had no method to retain the water and it ended up all over the bathroom floor *Lighting switches lamp by lamp - if you can believe it each light is turned on/off separately *Phone programming - you guesed it (not programmed so you have to contact the operator to be redirected every time) *No place for make-up when standing at the sink (so my wife wasn't happy) *Over priced food - salads $15 to $17, burger $20 (salads were ok, but otherwise very disappointing) $12 for 6 cookies and they were stale *Smoking - everyone that needs to smoke does so outside the front door (yes, it blows back inside) But for the location and friendly staff, I would definitely look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Unparalleled Service !!!”
Reviews.Author: Btokyo
Reviews.Content: Short stay but while I was there it was clear that the staff cares about every little detail to keep you very happy during your stay. As for cost performance, You will not find a better place

Reviews.Title: “This place is fun!”
Reviews.Author: fourmine
Reviews.Content: I only have praise for the W Los Angeles. My family (older children) stayed for 3 nights over Parents' Weekend at UCLA. I can't say enough about the hotel. The staff was amazing...incredibly friendly and accommodating. The room was perfect- spacious and comfortable for 3 adults. We especially enjoyed lounging at the pool. The outside temperature (high 80's) made the cool temperature of the pool water tolerable and refreshing. The food/drink was great there as well. We enjoyed going for cocktails and appetizers at dusk. The outside bar had a lively crowd and the service was excellent. The bar and indoor restaurant were great as well. The atmosphere throughout the hotel was so inviting. All the little touches are designed to please and they have suceeded at doing just that. This was an "easy" hotel stay. As a person working in the travel industry, it's something I've grown to truly appreciate. This is a hotel you really hate to leave!

Reviews.Title: “Pricey with Inconsistent Service”
Reviews.Author: TinyAbuDhabi
Reviews.Content: Great Westwood location bordering the UCLA campus on a relatively quiet street. Rooms were clean but not very well sound-insulated so that I heard a lot of racket from my neighbors. Concierge, reception, valets, and bellhops were helpful throughout my stay. By contrast, the restaurant featured slow, inattentive, service that both mixed-up and forgot elements of my orders on two occasions. On my day of departure, two different housekeepers disturbed me to ask whether, and when, I was checking out. Room rates, food and mini-bar prices, and service charges were all quite high compared to other hotels with similar features but better overall service.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel experiences we have ever had.”
Reviews.Author: joellc
Reviews.Content: Told the General Manager in an email that from the minute we checked in until checkout we were treated like visiting royalty. First we were upgraded to a suite then received great help from the concierge desk onto a delightful experince at a brunch we hosted outside at the pool and then to the engineering department coming immediately to my rescue to get me on WiFi for the first time. In addition my wife asked a question about something she saw in the restaurant and received an instant note in response with all of the info she requested. We could go on and on but I think you get the message. The "W" on Los angeles is a fantastic hotel with the best staff ever.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for LA”
Reviews.Author: nyc_digitaldad
Reviews.Content: Room design is quite elegant -- other comments seem to confuse minimalism with cheapness. This stuff ain't cheap. Likes: - toasted marshmallows and iced tea at the front desk each afternoon - exercise room: really clean and modern, great equipment, tvs, etc. - free and very good coffee in the morning - great location - off of the commercial strip of westwod and on a more intimate, tree-lined street - really nice lobby decor with many different flavors of lounge/drinking options. Not everyone's cup of tea i gather but right up my alley. Dislike - basic 1-bedroom suite too small (in bedroom you couldn't get to the window without walking over the merely full-sized bed). Go for a studio suite (1 big room) instead.

Reviews.Title: “A very good hotel in a very nice area”
Reviews.Author: EYtraveller
Reviews.Content: The W Los Angeles is located in Westwood. Westwood is the home of UCLA and Westwood Village which is a great place. The Hotel is walking distance to the campus, several great restaurants, Diddy Reese cookies, Stan's Doughnuts and BJs. The hotel is located about a mile from the I-405. It is about 3 miles from Beverly Hills. While it is a little further out of the way, it is a lovely place to stay without all the hustle and bustle of LA/ Beverly Hills. The service at the hotel is very good and lives up to the W standard. Lance welcomes you as soon as you stop. The hotel has valet parking ( $35 a day which irritates me). The hotel also has the Acura experience. An acura MDX drives you around the immediate vicinity for free. It is very nice. I had a specatcular suite which was very roomy. All of the rooms in this hotel are supposed to be suites. The room had a spacious living room with a large plasma tv. The beds are very comfortable and there was another LCD tv in the bedroom. The bathroom was modern with a good shower and good water pressure. There was no bathtub however. Internet is not free ( $14.95 per day, another irritation). The rooms were cleaned well however, I happen to like the Bliss products so I keep them for travel use. After the 2nd day the maid stopped replacing them. I was not happy with this. Ive never been to a hotel where this happen. And in doing this she didnt replace the shampoo an conditioner which were empty and needed replacing. SWEAT ( the hotel gym) is adequare with TechnoGym equipment. There are treadmills, ellipticals and bikes all with tvs. There are also dumbells up to 50 lbs and an ab machine. There is water, apples and cold towels. However, they did not provide earphones for the gym. The pool is nice and a nice place to relax. I ate at the restaurant 930 which was a very pleasant meal. The appetizers , entrees, drinks and desserts were good as well as the service. This was my 2nd times staying here and will stay here again

Reviews.Title: “A great weekend @ W hotel los angeles”
Reviews.Author: lux16
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at other W hotels, i love their whatever/whenever services, and besides the Hong Kong, and the new W hotel at Fort Lauderdale, this one was great too! For those who have never stayed at a W hotel, its a very trendy, young, place to stay. I spent the weekend with my boyfriend just to get away, and the W was perfect for us, because we just stayed around beverly hills area. Parking is $32 dollars a day, there is free wireless internet in the lobby or you pay $19 dollars a day to have internet access in the room. The pool is amazing, there are always events happening at the W on the weekends. Ralphs grocery store is a block walk away, pretty convenent to get any anything if you need it. I had the spectacular room, which had a seperate living room and a bedroom =) i enjoyed my stayed there a lot! I will definately go back when i have time!!

Reviews.Title: “Wow - what an amazing hotel, my home away from home.”
Reviews.Author: familydoclv
Reviews.Content: I visit the UCLA area regularly and found this amazing hotel through the Starwood Preferred Guest Network. Each trip, I am always impressed by the friendly staff greeting me at the door to take my bags and making sure I have everything I need throughout my stay. There is a courtesy car available on a first-come first-serve basis that is truly a luxury experience. One evening, a family member traveling with me wanted a particular chocolate bar not available through room service, so one of the hotel employees purchased it from a nearby grocery store and personally delivered it to my room. Amazing experiences like that will keep me coming back to this hotel each and every time I visit the Los Angeles area - I wouldn't stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Lobby smells like garbage”
Reviews.Author: tommyp239
Reviews.Content: Typically W's have the familiar W smell - this one however smells like garbage in the lobby area. Rooms have been fine but the lobby smells like garbage - 2 weeks in a row.

Reviews.Title: “Rude staff & very noisey at night”
Reviews.Author: Munkyworld
Reviews.Content: What a let down this hotel was. We had just arrived from a 14 hour flight from Australia and were checking in when the receptionist spotted our duty free bag and advised it would be confiscated! Apparently no alcohol is allowed to be brought into the hotel that is not sold in the hotel - what a mad policy... we do 50 hotel nights a year and have NEVER had our duty free confiscated by the hotel... what a crazy policy. This all happened at reception and was quite embarrassing.... have never had this sort of treatment elsehwere. The staff were all VERY rude and up themselves. We stayed from THUR-SUN and the room noise on FRI/SAT was unbearable.... For the price there are sure to be better alternatives... the pool also was very small... more like a paddling pool. Breakfast for 2 was about $60 in the restaurant... beware they advertise free coffee in the room downstairs, but it is only free if you pour it yourself... when sitting down it is $4 per cup. Also unlike most USA hotels they charge $14.95 for internet, parking is also on the pricey side at $32.

Reviews.Title: “One Word - DUMP”
Reviews.Author: willows22
Reviews.Content: To be honest I had been told that The W was going to be the most amazing hotel, but very sadly it was completley the opposite. The lifts did not work, I and at least 5 others were stuck in one for nearly 20 mins onr evening. The service was not good and the decor very dated, this is a very pricey hotel that I will not be visiting again and I would say think twice about booking here and look around, the area was nice but the hotel a big dissapointment, I even had items billed to my room that were someone had just made up my room number.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Very Nice Stay at the W”
Reviews.Author: pacifica_gal
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed a nice two night stay at the W over the 4th of July weekend. Although previous posters have mentioned poor service, the service we experienced, from the front desk to the concierge to the pool staff were all friendly and helpful. The building is definitely older, but the decor is modern. The lobby has the cool, clean style of the other W's. I'm just sorry I didn't grab one of the cupcakes when we checked-in. They were gone by the time we came back down to the lobby. We had a corner room so it may have been slightly larger than the others. It was nice to have a separate sitting room with a TV and desk. The view from the bedroom wasn't that great - right above the generator looking into another buidling, but we didn't spend much time in there anyway. The bathroom was really spacious and had a great shower. The only thing I didn't like was the small sink. It's too easy to splash water around the vanity. The Bliss products were great! One of the reasons we selected the W was because of the pool. It was actually much smaller than I had envisioned (and would have guessed looking at the pictures), so it was quite crowded when we went to check it out the first day. It was later in the day, so we didn't actually go to the pool. But we went down to the pool early on Saturday morning to stake our claim to two pool chairs. I guess many people come to the pool who aren't hotel guests, so they actually had "security" at the pool entrance. Service at the pool was a little slow at times, but they came around to check on us fairly regularly. One nice thing about the pool area is they have magazines and sunscreen for guests to use. No need to run out to the drug store if you forgot your sunscreen! The food was a little expensive for what it was, but it was well prepared - although it's a bit hard to eat on the pool chairs without a table. Even though we only stayed for two nights, the hotel staff seemed to recognize us and welcome us back whenever we walked in or rode the elevator. Because the buiiding is older (it seems like it's a converted apartment or condo complex), the walls are thin and it can get noisy. I'm glad we requested a room away from the elevators. I also thought it was interesting that we had to sign a document that said we wouldn't have more than 4 people in the room. I guess they've had plenty of party and noise complaints.... The location of the hotel is good - there's plenty to walk to in the Westwood area. Don't miss Stan's Donuts.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at the W”
Reviews.Author: jodilgold
Reviews.Content: We spent six nights at the W Westwood using our Starwood points and paid for an upgrade to a suite with 3 rooms including an office. Room was very spacious and nice. I've stayed at the W in Seattle, which I felt was a nicer much more upscale hotel but the W in Westwood was still very nice. The staff at the W was very nice as well. We didn't experience any problems and no one was rude to us at any time. Everyone was very helpful and accomodating. We did have a car and we did listen to another reviewer and looked for street parking and were able to find some very close by for 3 nights of our stay. That's far better than paying $34 per day plus tips for valet service. Even the valets helped us locate legal spaces right across from the hotel. The drinks and restaurant are very expensive ($15 per drink) and I didn't think the drinks were that great. But the pool atmosphere and bar are very nice. Really enjoyed our outdoor time there. The area was more residential, but having a car certainly helped and we were able to get everywhere we wanted to go very easily. There are some nice restaurants down the street and the neighborhood is very safe to walk around even at night. As far as the room goes, it was very large. 2 flat screen TVs, comfy bed. There was very limited counter space in the bathroom and not enough mirrors in the room. As I wrote earlier, the W in Seattle is gorgeous and the W in Westwood is very nice. This W is comfortable, trendy and fun but if the W Seattle represents W standard, than this W is a just a step down and I think that is mostly because of the furnishings which are not as sophisticated as the other W hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny Bathrooms; Rude Bliss Spa Staff!”
Reviews.Author: LasVegasLaura69
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the W in Westwood twice now. Love the central location, but that is about it. Tried to book a manicure at Bliss Spa on a Friday afternoon -- the spa staff was RUDE and unaccomodating. They only had one nail technician on a busy Friday and could not book me an appointment. Our room was nice, but the bathroom was incredibly small. There is no counter spa for toiletries. I had to blow dry my hair in the other room. The lightbulb was out in our magnifying mirror in the bathroom, and without it, forget trying to shave or apply your makeup. The bathroom is dark, and again, NO COUNTER SPACE!

Reviews.Title: “could have been better”
Reviews.Author: shark4rk
Reviews.Content: wonderful rooms. the shower and the sinks kept breaking down. but the engineers kept doing their best. the rooms were very nice. problem was that the hotel was crowded with ucla students. i really did not appreciate that. the last time i stayed there was a more business feel to it. now it felt like a grouping of kids. not so good. overall though a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Fun Fun”
Reviews.Author: aztravler1
Reviews.Content: The room I had was huge. The bar downstairs was so much fun and they had a live DJ. It feels kind of cool that you get to walk right past the velvet ropes and the people waiting in line.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience W Hotel LA”
Reviews.Author: keyless2
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to share my experience at the W Hotel in LA. The beautiful contemporary look is what I love but mostly whatever your looking for, actually as they would answer when you call "What is Your Wish", the staff are always willing to go above and beyond and even when you think maybe they won't be able to do something.......they do! We got 3 rooms, all were extremely clean, the food was great along side the pool and overall just an outstanding experience I have stayed at the W Hotel in New York in Time Square; my friends and I Loved It as well! They were happy to give us a ride in their car so long as it was available which it was every time! Everyone is always so helpful and friendly! Cheers and Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “They Could've Tried Just A Little Bit Harder....................”
Reviews.Author: NYC_Pat_C
Reviews.Content: The W Los Angeles Westwood is a quaint hotel in a residential area which we loved. The hotel lobby was chic, sexy and inviting. We arrived early and to our surprise they did have a room available for us.(A definite plus) However the view was horrible !!!!!! The Backyard and 930 Dining areas were EXTREMELY expensive. The Concierge was less than helpful. She almost made me feel like I was being a pain in the toosh when I asked for directions around town. The W made me feel like they were doing me a FAVOR by letting me stay at their hotel. YOU GOT IT ALL WRONG W, Its people like me traveling in this tough economy that allow your hotel to remain business !!!! What's the deal with the complimentary rides within 5 miles ?????? No one ever offered it or mentioned yet the car sat out front all DAY and everytime you called the lobby and was placed on hold for 5-10 minutes you heard the recording about the complimentary service ???????? The motto whatever whenver is BS ! My husband and I winged it though, got on the bus and had a great time in LA. Eat out if you can unless you dont mind getting your pockets turned inside out. Lunch in the back ran us $135 Breakfast at 930 ran us another $80. But the experience in LA walking down the walk of fame pass Michael Jacksons starL PRICELESS :-)

Reviews.Title: “Style without substance”
Reviews.Author: PaigeLeeds
Reviews.Content: Sure, W Hotels are chic, and I appreciate artwork in my room and a couch, but when it comes down to the brass tacks of travel needs, the W Westwood misses every opportunity to shine. From a reservation system that forgets to list both members of your party as guests, to a hotel gym missing work out mats and other essentials, to exorbitant pricing for internet ($15/day and $1 a page to print from the hotel kiosks), to sub-par expensive meals in the diner, to the tiny hotel pool, to the marginally friendly hotel staff, to little storage in bathrooms or closets, W Westwood leaves a lot to be desired. Point is, in this economy, as travelers seeking a bit of style, we have a lot of options and the little touches, listed above, count. I'd stay here again only if I needed to be in this (rather fun, walkable) neighborhood. Otherwise, I'd be better off for the value and service in another 4 star hotel in LA.

Reviews.Title: “Core hotel staff rock like the Stones; valets act like Hells Angels at Altamont”
Reviews.Author: Jonnoh64
Reviews.Content: I travel for business every week and made a point of trying the W in LA as I've always enjoyed the Ws in Seattle and New York. While it was a bit out of the way, I read the reviews here in Trip Advisor and was curious about the mix of comments. My experience started VERY badly as I was greeted aggressively by a valet/security guy at curbside who snapped that i was parking in a hotel zone. I replied "great, because I'm checking in" he then asked if I was "sure" that I was a guest <!> I stifled the snappy comebacks that sprang to mind (e.g., "Seeing as you've created this *great* first impression, NO, I'm not sure I want to be a guest"). In case you're wondering if I was dressed like Jed Clampett driving a jalopy, take it on faith I wasn't. It was an unimpressive Hertz Honda Accord - i guess that wasn't up to his standard. Fortunately, my experience at check in was very nice and the room was great. Bellman brought up my bag within two minutes of my arrival and gave a quick overview of the room features. As a Starwood Platinum I was upgraded to a King Suite which was clean, very well appointed and stylish (typical W style and standard). As it was late evening, I opted to eat at one of the two in-house restaurants. Thinking I was entering the bar area of the restaurant, I mistakenly approached the in-house lounge. The bouncer and hostess at the lounge were very polite and offered me the appetizer menu for their area or suggested I consider the adjacent restaurant ("9:15") if I wanted a full dinner. I opted for the full restaurant but sat at its bar seating. I had a good martini and had a very good dinner. Appetizer of mushrooms was excellent and the main course (duck) was very good, cooked to order and generous. Prices are towards the high end but not unexpected. Back to the room to do some work in the full size office area and then to bed. In the morning, my shower was more eventful than hoped for as the shower curtain (as others have noted) was determined to wrap, entangle and smother me. I pushed it out of the tub and, post shower, noticed that i left about a gallon of water tubside. When preparing to leave, I called ahead to have my car brought up. I went to the valet area. No car. Spoke to the valet and he asked for my ticket. Then my name. Then my room number. At this point 20+ minutes had elapsed since my call and i'd been standing there for about 10. No apology offered (or expected given the previous night's experience) I went back in and asked for a manager to explain why they couldn't make this simple process of retrieving cars work - especially when they charge $32 a day for parking! (the charge itself isn't an issue for me as I am on expenses, but even for LA hotel parking it is high and, more to the point, it is completely screwed up). All in all, a great experience sandwiched between very poor first and last impressions. Unless I need to be in that part of LA I wouldn't consider this hotel again - I think other hotels will offer more consistent, good service for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and most rooms are suites.”
Reviews.Author: lionsnwings
Reviews.Content: This is my favorite hotel when traveling to LA. The location is great and I spotted a couple celebrities.

Reviews.Title: “Front entrance people have watched "Bodyguard" too many times.”
Reviews.Author: t g
Reviews.Content: I first must say that I was not staying in the hotel, but at a nearby hotel in Westwood. I remember when this place was called the Westwood Marquis. It is really almost an apartment building that they call a hotel. So I was curious, and walked over to check it out. The first thing I noticed was several large employees standing around the entrance steps, wearing those silly mini microphones and curly behind the ear Secret Service earphones. Even though I was wearing a tie and a jacket, I felt uncomfortable just walking up the steps to the front door. I expected to see a nice lobby, essentially a public place that one can check out. Instead, it is really a large foyer, with a check in desk and elevators. I was quickly accosted by an ostensibly friendly large employee who asked "May I help you?", but more in the manner that a retail clerk asks if they suspect someone is shoplifting!! I explained that I was just visiting the property, scouting it for a possible future trip, and the employee nicely took me out into the garden area ,told me when lunches and Sunday brunches are served, etc.. I thanked him for the tour and left,feeling that I had been "handled". I have stayed in major hotels all over the world, and so I don't think I was overwhelmed or intimidated, but instead I got the impression that this place is stuck on itself as a very "secure" place for celebrities, and that the guys in the lobby and the front step area have a Kevin Costner "bodyguard" complex. So maybe it is just "me" in this case, but I think this place is overly impressed with itself. I have not experienced this at the Beverly Hills Hotel or the Huntington in Pasadena. In short, the place had no class. I think it prefers to cater to hip hop stars than regular people.

Reviews.Title: “Great location--perfect stay”
Reviews.Author: sleepladypalmdesert
Reviews.Content: We chose this facility due to a great rate we were able to get along with the convenient location to UCLA as it was the weekend of my son's college graduation. I was a little concerned due to some of the poor reviews I read here on Trip Advisor. I wanted to make sure to post a review, as we had a really perfect visit. We arrived on Friday afternoon. Parking in LA is always difficult, so we chose to have our car parked. The 35.00/day cost was a little high, but it was safe and convenient. Elizabeth, from the Welcome Desk, let us know we were being upgraded to a Suite. She was very friendly and efficient. Our room was very nice. A two room suite with very nice bathroom. Plenty of room for our belongings on the large table in the bathroom. The room was very clean and interesting. Large flat screen TVs were both in the bedroom and living room area. Our son walked over from his apartment, which he shares with a number of roommates. We ate in the "backyard" area. There was a really nice guy who was BBQing interesting items. He was very personable and did an excellent job preparing and "selling" different items for us to try. Our waiter was excellent. The grilled Salmon for 15.00 was a steal. Delicious. We had a few drinks and ate. Followed by the Peanut Butter chocolate cake, very good. We awakened the next morning and had coffee on the house which was served downstairs along with purchasing a couple croissants. Very good coffee. The bed was very comfortable. Nice linens and pillows. We really liked the two room set up, as I tend to awaken very early and it allows my husband to sleep later. We all met up and walked over to the graduation ceremony, just a couple of blocks from the hotel to the campus. We spent the day, after the ceremony, walking around Westwood. We ate brunch at Jerry's, caught a movie, and then walked over to Palamino for champagne and appetizers as we were not too hungry after the large brunch. We ended back at our hotel and relaxed around the outdoor pool area. Finally we ended up in 9 thirty restaurant for coffee and dessert. Our last night was excellent, check out was perfect, collected our bags and car and left. We would definately recommend trying his facility. It was very nice, great location, and staff were excellent and personable.

Reviews.Title: “What you expect from a W”
Reviews.Author: Azgators
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel location to start your exploring of LA from. Let me begin by saying we do not usually travel to large cities, and quite frankly do not look for that kind of trip. We decided it was due time to see all the glitz and glamour of the Hollywood and Beverly Hills area of LA. This hotel had a great location as far as being an easy drive to anywhere you'd want to go, including the beaches of Santa Monica. Just remember that you will be in Westwood, which is a college town, there will not be stars out the front door. However, when we were at the W they were filming a commercial for Maybeline with Haley Berry, so there goes that idea. The W is a very very "hip" and "cool" place to relax. As far as service went we had absolutely no problems whatsoever. We did not come across anybody that was "too good" to talk to us or to answer our questions. Checkin and out both with smoothly. The Valets were friendly upon arrival/departure and always said something nice or asked if we needed a cab. We never used room service nor did we valet our car. Turns out that there is tons of easy to find street parking around the hotel, so save your $34 unless you will be spending a lot of time in your room in the middle of the day and will be going in and out often. The rooms were great. Exactly how a W should look. We were told that we were upgraded to a corner "spectacular suite" because we are platinum preferred Starwood members, and we used our points for this stay. On that note I would never pay the going rate for this room, I would only stay there using points. A few complaints about the room. The shower curtain liner is HORRIBLE. It basically tries to attack you the entire time you are in the shower. You are basically forced to hang it up on the tub and flood the floor of the bathroom. Why they do not have the curved shower curtain rod that even motel 6's have, i have no idea. Ther other complaint is the bed. Its just not comfortable. They claim they have a special W bed, but each morning we woke up with lower back pain. I'd expect a better bed. Road noise from outside is very load. Basically it sounds like the windows are open all the time, but remember, its in the middle of LA, so what can I expect. We were even on the 8th floor, so this was a surprise. As others notied, the Bliss products that you find in the room and in the spa are great. Definately live up to the quality of the hotel and live up to what you expect from a W. There are plenty of places to eat and shop a short walk from the hotel, so thats always nice. Overall its a nice place. Parking in all of LA is a ripoff so no change here. Would we return?? Probably not unless we were using our Starwood points. There are just too many other nice hotels in LA to keep going back to the same ones.

Reviews.Title: “Frequent guest, but no more ...”
Reviews.Author: ThePlainsman
